original: rnyed pa dang bkur sti ni bdag gi don sgrub pas khyim la ser sna byed pa dang / chags par byed par brtags par bya'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa dang bkur sti ni bdag gi don sgrub pas khyim la ser sna byed pa dang / chags par byed par brtags par bya'o //
translated: One should consider that gain and honor are the cause for being stingy and greedy with regard to one’s home.

original: rnyed pa dang bkur sti ni g-yo byed par brtags par bya'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa dang bkur sti ni g-yo byed par brtags par bya'o //
translated: One should consider that gain and honor are the cause for being deceitful.

original: rnyed pa dang bkur sti ni 'phags pa'i rigs bzhi yongs spongs bas /
analyzed: rnyed pa dang bkur sti ni 'phags pa'i rigs bzhi yongs spongs bas /
translated: One should consider that gain and honor are the cause for abandoning the four noble traditions.

original: ngo tsha med pa dang khrel med pa skyed par brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: ngo tsha med pa dang khrel med pa skyed par brtag par bya'o //
translated: One should consider that gain and honor are the cause for shamelessness and lack of embarassment.

original: rnyed pa dang bkur sti ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyis ma gnang bar brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa dang bkur sti ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyis ma gnang bar brtag par bya'o //
translated: One should consider that gain and honor are not approved by the Buddhas.

original: rnyed pa dang bkur sti ni nga rgyal dang / rgyags pa dang / dregs pa skyed par brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa dang bkur sti ni nga rgyal dang / rgyags pa dang / dregs pa skyed par brtag par bya'o //
translated: One should consider that gain and honor are the cause for pride, arrogance, and conceit.

original: rnyed pa dang bkur sti ni bla ma rnams la khyad du gsod par brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa dang bkur sti ni bla ma rnams la khyad du gsod par brtag par bya'o //
translated: One should consider that gain and honor are the cause for disrespecting gurus.

original: rnyed pa dang bkur sti ni bdud kyi phyogs su brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa dang bkur sti ni bdud kyi phyogs su brtag par bya'o //
translated: One should consider that gain and honor are the cause for being on Māra’s side.

original: rnyed pa dang bkur sti ni gcig tu bag med pa'i rtsa ba yin par brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa dang bkur sti ni gcig tu bag med pa'i rtsa ba yin par brtag par bya'o //
translated: One should see that gain and honor are the root of all heedlessness.

original: rnyed pa dang bkur sti ni dge ba'i rtsa ba 'phrog par brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa dang bkur sti ni dge ba'i rtsa ba 'phrog par brtag par bya'o //
translated: One should see that gain and honor are the thieves of the roots of virtue.

original: rnyed pa dang bkur sti ni glog dang 'khor lo dang lce 'bab pa lta bur brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa dang bkur sti ni glog dang 'khor lo dang lce 'bab pa lta bur brtag par bya'o //
translated: One should see that gain and honor are like lightning, a revolving fire-brand, or a flash of lightning.

original: rnyed pa dang bkur sti ni sbags pa mang por sbags par brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa dang bkur sti ni sbags pa mang por sbags par brtag par bya'o //
translated: One should see that gain and honor are the cause of much pollution.

original: rnyed pa @70b dang bkur sti ni mdza' bshes kyi khyim dang slong mo ster ba'i khyim la brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa @70b dang bkur sti ni mdza' bshes kyi khyim dang slong mo ster ba'i khyim la brtag par bya'o //
translated: One should see that gain and honor are the cause of the homes of friends and the homes of benefactors.

original: rnyed pa dang bkur sti ni blo rnam par 'khrul pa byed par brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa dang bkur sti ni blo rnam par 'khrul pa byed par brtag par bya'o //
translated: One should see that gain and honor are the cause of the confusion of the mind.

original: rnyed pa dang bkur sti ni sdug pa'i dngos po 'gyur bar byed pa'i phyir mya ngan skyed par brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa dang bkur sti ni sdug pa'i dngos po 'gyur bar byed pa'i phyir mya ngan skyed par brtag par bya'o //
translated: One should see that gain and honor are the cause of the arising of sorrow, because they change what is dear.

original: rnyed pa dang bkur sti ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gzhi rjed par byed par brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa dang bkur sti ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gzhi rjed par byed par brtag par bya'o //
translated: One should see that gain and honor are the cause of the loss of the foundations of mindfulness.

original: rnyed pa dang bkur sti ni dkar po'i chos nyam chung bar byed par brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa dang bkur sti ni dkar po'i chos nyam chung bar byed par brtag par bya'o //
translated: You should see material gain and honor as a sign of the weakness of your wholesome actions.

original: rnyed pa dang bkur sti yang dag par spong ba bzhi yongs su nyams par byed par brtag par bya'o //🔽rnyed pa dang bkur sti ni pha rol gyi dad pa'i bar chad byed par brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa dang bkur sti yang dag par spong ba bzhi yongs su nyams par byed par brtag par bya'o // rnyed pa dang bkur sti ni pha rol gyi dad pa'i bar chad byed par brtag par bya'o //
translated: You should see material gain and honor as a sign of the decline of the four right efforts.🔽You should see material gain and honor as a sign of the decline of faith in others.🔽You should see material gain and honor as a sign of the decline of the superknowledges and the higher knowledges.🔽You should see material gain and honor as a sign of the decline of respect.

original: rnyed pa dang bkur sti ni rdzu 'phrul dang mngon par shes pa nyams par byed par brtag par bya'o //🔽rnyed pa dang bkur sti ni sngar bkur sti byed la /
analyzed: rnyed pa dang bkur sti ni rdzu 'phrul dang mngon par shes pa nyams par byed par brtag par bya'o // rnyed pa dang bkur sti ni sngar bkur sti byed la /
translated: You should see material gain and honor as a sign of the decline of the Dharma.🔽You should see material gain and honor as a sign of the decline of the holy life.🔽You should see material gain and honor as a sign of the decline of the Buddha.🔽You should see material gain and honor as a sign of the decline of the Dharma.🔽You should see material gain and honor as a sign of the decline of the Saṅgha.🔽You should see material gain and honor as a sign of the decline of the spiritual life.🔽You should see material gain and honor as a sign of the decline of the path.

original: phyis bkur sti ni byed par brtag par bya'o //🔽rnyed pa dang bkur sti ni mi mdza' ba dang gnas par byed par brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: phyis bkur sti ni byed par brtag par bya'o // rnyed pa dang bkur sti ni mi mdza' ba dang gnas par byed par brtag par bya'o //
translated: You should see material gain and honor as a sign of the decline of the fruit.🔽You should see material gain and honor as a sign of the decline of the Dharma.🔽You should see material gain and honor as a sign of the decline of the Buddha.🔽You should see material gain and honor as a sign of the decline of the Dharma.🔽You should see material gain and honor as a sign of the decline of the Saṅgha.🔽You should see material gain and honor as a sign of the decline of the spiritual life.

original: rnyed pa dang bkur sti ni mdza' bo spong bar brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa dang bkur sti ni mdza' bo spong bar brtag par bya'o //
translated: You should see material gain and honor as a sign of the decline of the path.🔽You should see material gain and honor as a sign of the decline of the fruit.🔽You should see material gain and honor as a sign of the decline of the Dharma.🔽You should see material gain and honor as a sign of the decline of the Buddha.🔽You should see material gain and honor as a sign of the decline of the Dharma.🔽You should see material gain and honor as a sign of the decline of the Saṅgha.🔽You should see material gain and honor as a sign of the decline of the spiritual life.🔽You should see material gain and honor as a sign of the decline of the path.

original: rnyed pa dang bkur sti ni pha rol 'drid pa'i phyir smad 'tshong ma dang 'dra bar brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa dang bkur sti ni pha rol 'drid pa'i phyir smad 'tshong ma dang 'dra bar brtag par bya'o //
translated: You should see material gain and honor as a sign of the decline of the fruit.🔽You should see material gain

original: rnyed pa dang bkur sti ni bsam gtan dang tshad med pa yongs su spong bar brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa dang bkur sti ni bsam gtan dang tshad med pa yongs su spong bar brtag par bya'o //
translated: One should consider that gain and honor are the abandonment of meditative absorption and the immeasurables.

original: rnyed pa dang bkur sti ni sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro'i skye gnas dang gshin rje'i 'jig rten du lhung bar byed par brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa dang bkur sti ni sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro'i skye gnas dang gshin rje'i 'jig rten du lhung bar byed par brtag par bya'o //
translated: One should consider that gain and honor lead to falling into the hells, the animal realms, and the world of Yama.

original: rnyed pa dang bkur sti ni lha sbyin dang lhag spyod kyi cho ga dang mthun par brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa dang bkur sti ni lha sbyin dang lhag spyod kyi cho ga dang mthun par brtag par bya'o //
translated: One should consider that gain and honor are like the rites of Devadatta and Kokālika.

original: byams pa byang chub sems dpas rnyed pa dang bkur sti la nyes dmigs gang dag brtag par bya ba ni 'di lta bu 'di dag go //
analyzed: byams pa byang chub sems dpas rnyed pa dang bkur sti la nyes dmigs gang dag brtag par bya ba ni 'di lta bu 'di dag go //
translated: Maitreya, these are the disadvantages that a bodhisattva great being should see in gain and honor.

original: brtags nas kyang 'dod pa chung bar bya'i yongs su gdung bar ni mi bya'o //
analyzed: brtags nas kyang 'dod pa chung bar bya'i yongs su gdung bar ni mi bya'o //
translated: Having seen them, he should have few desires and not be tormented.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: byams pa byang chub sems dpa' 'dod pa chud pa la ni skyon 'di lta bu 'di dag med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: byams pa byang chub sems dpa' 'dod pa chud pa la ni skyon 'di lta bu 'di dag med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Maitreya, because for a bodhisattva great being who has few desires, these disadvantages do not exist.

original: de'i sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams la bar chad med pa yin /
analyzed: de'i sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams la bar chad med pa yin /
translated: There is no obstacle to his qualities of a buddha.

original: khyim pa dang rab tu byung ba dag yid 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba yin /
analyzed: khyim pa dang rab tu byung ba dag yid 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba yin /
translated: He is not disheartened by householders or renunciates.

original: lha dang mi rnams yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir gnas pas rjes su bsrung bar 'os pa yin /
analyzed: lha dang mi rnams yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir gnas pas rjes su bsrung bar 'os pa yin /
translated: He is worthy of being protected by those who abide in order to purify gods and humans.

original: ngan 'gro log par lhung ba thams cad kyis skrag pa med pa yin /
analyzed: ngan 'gro log par lhung ba thams cad kyis skrag pa med pa yin /
translated: He is fearless in the face of all the lower realms and bad rebirths.

original: sdig pa dang bral bas zil gyis mi non pa yin /
analyzed: sdig pa dang bral bas zil gyis mi non pa yin /
translated: He is unassailable because he is free from evil.

original: bdud kyi yul las yongs su grol bas mi 'phrogs pa yin /
analyzed: bdud kyi yul las yongs su grol bas mi 'phrogs pa yin /
translated: He is unassailable because he is liberated from the domain of Māra.

original: @71a * // sdug bsngal thams cad kyis mi tshugs pa yin /
analyzed: @71a * // sdug bsngal thams cad kyis mi tshugs pa yin /
translated: He is unassailable by any suffering.

original: lha dang mi rnams kyis mngon par 'dod par bya ba yin /
analyzed: lha dang mi rnams kyis mngon par 'dod par bya ba yin /
translated: He is desired by gods and humans.

original: bsam gtan la goms par byed par gnas par gsal ba yin /
analyzed: bsam gtan la goms par byed par gnas par gsal ba yin /
translated: He is clear in his practice of concentration.

original: g-yo dang sgyu spangs pa dang / 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la skyon du lta bas bag yod pa yin /
analyzed: g-yo dang sgyu spangs pa dang / 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la skyon du lta bas bag yod pa yin /
translated: He is conscientious because he has abandoned deceit and pretense and sees the five sense pleasures as faults.

original: 'phags pa'i rigs la gnas pas ji skad smras pa de bzhin byed pa yin /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i rigs la gnas pas ji skad smras pa de bzhin byed pa yin /
translated: He does what he says he will do because he abides in the family of the noble ones.

original: mkhas pa rnams dang tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams kyis 'dod pa yin te /
analyzed: mkhas pa rnams dang tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams kyis 'dod pa yin te /
translated: This is the wish of the wise and of those who are spiritual friends.

original: byams pa phan yon 'di lta bu 'di dag shes na /
analyzed: byams pa phan yon 'di lta bu 'di dag shes na /
translated: Maitreya, if you know these benefits,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mkhas pa rnyed pa dang bkur sti yongs su spangs pas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mkhas pa rnyed pa dang bkur sti yongs su spangs pas /
translated: the wise bodhisattva great beings, having abandoned gain and honor,

original: rnyed pa dang bkur sti thams cad spang ba'i phyir /🔽lhag pa'i bsam pas 'dod pa chung ba la gnas par bya zhing /
analyzed: rnyed pa dang bkur sti thams cad spang ba'i phyir / lhag pa'i bsam pas 'dod pa chung ba la gnas par bya zhing /
translated: in order to abandon all gain and honor,🔽with an altruistic intention should abide in few desires

original: 'dod pa chung ba la kun du bsten par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dod pa chung ba la kun du bsten par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: and should rely on few desires.

original: yul 'khor skyong gi mdo las kyang /
analyzed: yul 'khor skyong gi mdo las kyang /
translated: The Rāṣṭrapāla Sūtra also says,

original: yang dag ma bsdams rgod cing khengs pa can //
analyzed: yang dag ma bsdams rgod cing khengs pa can //
translated: Those who are undisciplined, wild, and conceited,

original: ma gus nga rgyal ldan zhing chags shes che //
analyzed: ma gus nga rgyal ldan zhing chags shes che //
translated: disrespectful, proud, and very greedy,

original: nyon mongs zil non tha ba  nyon mongs can //
analyzed: nyon mongs zil non tha ba  nyon mongs can //
translated: overpowered by afflictions, hard, and full of afflictions—

original: de 'dra dag la byang chub mchog rab ring //🔽chags pas zil gyis non na le lo 'phel //
analyzed: de 'dra dag la byang chub mchog rab ring // chags pas zil gyis non na le lo 'phel //
translated: for such people, supreme enlightenment is very far away.🔽If you are overpowered by attachment, laziness increases.

original: le los zil gyis non na dad pa nyams //
analyzed: le los zil gyis non na dad pa nyams //
translated: If you are overpowered by laziness, faith declines.

original: dad pa nyams na tshul khrims rab tu nyams //
analyzed: dad pa nyams na tshul khrims rab tu nyams //
translated: If faith declines, morality declines.

original: tshul khrims 'chal par gyur na bzang 'gro nyams //
analyzed: tshul khrims 'chal par gyur na bzang 'gro nyams //
translated: If morality declines, good rebirths decline.

original: dbul por gyur pas rab tu byung gyur te //
analyzed: dbul por gyur pas rab tu byung gyur te //
translated: If one is poor, one goes forth.

original: mchod pa rnyed nas dbul las grol bar 'gyur //🔽de dag gser gyi khur ni bor nas su //
analyzed: mchod pa rnyed nas dbul las grol bar 'gyur // de dag gser gyi khur ni bor nas su //
translated: Having obtained offerings, one is freed from poverty.🔽They are like those who, having abandoned a load of gold,

original: gso ma'i khur ni len par byed dang mtshungs //
analyzed: gso ma'i khur ni len par byed dang mtshungs //
translated: take up a load of chaff.

original: rnyed pa don du gnyer bas dgon par 'gro //
analyzed: rnyed pa don du gnyer bas dgon par 'gro //
translated: Seeking gain, they go to the wilderness.

original: der song nas ni gos dang nye du tshol //
analyzed: der song nas ni gos dang nye du tshol //
translated: Having gone there, they seek clothing and relatives.

original: mngon shes rig dang spobs  pa phun sum tshogs //
analyzed: mngon shes rig dang spobs  pa phun sum tshogs //
translated: Having abandoned supernormal knowledge, insight, and perfect eloquence,

original: bor nas de ni phyir yang nye du 'dzin //
analyzed: bor nas de ni phyir yang nye du 'dzin //
translated: they again grasp at relatives.

original: rmongs nas nga rgyal dbang gis ngan song sa //
analyzed: rmongs nas nga rgyal dbang gis ngan song sa //
translated: Through delusion and the power of pride, they go to the lower realms.🔽They grasp at the unfavorable states of existence, poverty,🔽birth in a low caste, blindness,

original: mi khom 'gro ba rnams dang dbul po dang // dma' ba'i rigs su skye dang long ba dang // mdog ngan pa dang mthu chung de dag 'dzin //
analyzed: mi khom 'gro ba rnams dang dbul po dang // dma' ba'i rigs su skye dang long ba dang // mdog ngan pa dang mthu chung de dag 'dzin //
translated: an ugly appearance, and weakness.

original: de dag tshul dang spyod pa yongs nyams dngos //
analyzed: de dag tshul dang spyod pa yongs nyams dngos //
translated: They truly ruin their conduct and behavior.

original: bag med rnyed nas dran pa rab tu nyams //
analyzed: bag med rnyed nas dran pa rab tu nyams //
translated: Having become heedless, they lose their mindfulness.

original: g-yang sa chen po mi bzad ltung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: g-yang sa chen po mi bzad ltung bar 'gyur //
translated: Will fall into the great abyss of the lower realms.

original: de nas bskal pa bye bar thar pa med //
analyzed: de nas bskal pa bye bar thar pa med //
translated: For millions of eons, they will not be free.

original: gal te 'dir ni 'thob par byang chub na //
analyzed: gal te 'dir ni 'thob par byang chub na //
translated: If enlightenment is attained by just a few,

original: de'i phyir lha sbyin gyis kyang byang chub 'thob //
analyzed: de'i phyir lha sbyin gyis kyang byang chub 'thob //
translated: Then even Devadatta should have attained enlightenment.

original: rnam par 'thor rlung gis ni bya lhung ltar //
analyzed: rnam par 'thor rlung gis ni bya lhung ltar //
translated: Just as a bird cannot fly with a clipped wing,

original: chags pas kyang ni @71b de ltar mi rigs so //
analyzed: chags pas kyang ni @71b de ltar mi rigs so //
translated: So too is it with attachment.

original: bsod nams nyams shing gzhan gyi chung ma chags //
analyzed: bsod nams nyams shing gzhan gyi chung ma chags //
translated: Their merit will decline, and they will lust after others’ wives.

original: tshul khrims ma dag dge ba rnams las nyams //
analyzed: tshul khrims ma dag dge ba rnams las nyams //
translated: Their discipline will be impure, and they will fall from virtue.

original: byang chub sems kyi ye shes gang ma thob //
analyzed: byang chub sems kyi ye shes gang ma thob //
translated: Those who have not attained the wisdom of the mind of awakening

original: de dag bstan la mi dgos ngur shing bzhin //
analyzed: de dag bstan la mi dgos ngur shing bzhin //
translated: Are not needed in the teachings, like a peacock is not needed in a flock of vultures.

original: byang chub don gnyer sangs rgyas chos 'tshol ba //
analyzed: byang chub don gnyer sangs rgyas chos 'tshol ba //
translated: Those who strive for enlightenment, who seek the Buddha’s teachings,

original: ji ltar thar pa de bzhin mi gnas so //
analyzed: ji ltar thar pa de bzhin mi gnas so //
translated: Do not remain like those who seek freedom.

original: de ni rnyong gis spre'u la dam byas ltar //
analyzed: de ni rnyong gis spre'u la dam byas ltar //
translated: They are like a monkey caught in a trap:

original: nga rgyal zil non byang chub de 'dra'o //
analyzed: nga rgyal zil non byang chub de 'dra'o //
translated: Their pride is subdued, and so is their enlightenment.

original: byang chub don du gnyer ba chos tshig phyir //
analyzed: byang chub don du gnyer ba chos tshig phyir //
translated: Those who strive for enlightenment, for the sake of the Dharma’s words,

original: nga yis rang gi srog ni phangs pa 'ang btang //🔽chos de btang nas brtson dang mi ldan pa //
analyzed: nga yis rang gi srog ni phangs pa 'ang btang // chos de btang nas brtson dang mi ldan pa //
translated: I gave up my life, which is so dear to me.🔽If I were to give up the Dharma and not be diligent,

original: don med gyur nas bstan las lhung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: don med gyur nas bstan las lhung bar 'gyur //
translated: I would be useless and fall from the teaching.

original: nga ni sngon chad legs par bshad don phyir //
analyzed: nga ni sngon chad legs par bshad don phyir //
translated: In the past, for the sake of good explanations,

original: g-yang sa chen po me lce 'bar bar mchongs //
analyzed: g-yang sa chen po me lce 'bar bar mchongs //
translated: I jumped into a great abyss of blazing flames.

original: de thos nas ni sdug dang mi sdug pa //
analyzed: de thos nas ni sdug dang mi sdug pa //
translated: Having heard that, I gave up all that is pleasant and unpleasant

original: thams cad rnam par spangs te nan tan gnas //
analyzed: thams cad rnam par spangs te nan tan gnas //
translated: and have practiced with perseverance.

original: bstan pa sna tshogs yon tan 'byor thos la //
analyzed: bstan pa sna tshogs yon tan 'byor thos la //
translated: Having heard the teaching, which is an abundance of good qualities,

original: de dag nam yang 'dod pa mi skyo na //
analyzed: de dag nam yang 'dod pa mi skyo na //
translated: I am never dissatisfied.

original: chos min 'dod la byang chub ga la yod //
analyzed: chos min 'dod la byang chub ga la yod //
translated: How could there be enlightenment for those who desire what is contrary to the Dharma?

original: dper na long ba lam gsal med dang mtshungs //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: dper na long ba lam gsal med dang mtshungs // zhes gsungs so //
translated: They are like the blind, for whom there is no light.

original: chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid rnam par spros pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po las kyang /
analyzed: chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid rnam par spros pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po las kyang /
translated: The King of Samādhi, the Equality of All Phenomena, also says:🔽Those deceived by the profit of knowledge

original: shes kyi khe yis bslus pa dag / nga yi bstan las shin tu 'khyams //
analyzed: shes kyi khe yis bslus pa dag / nga yi bstan las shin tu 'khyams //
translated: are completely lost from my teaching.

original: 'bras bur 'du shes gnas pa la //
analyzed: 'bras bur 'du shes gnas pa la //
translated: Those who are attached to the idea of results

original: dge sbyong nor ni gsog tu gyur //
analyzed: dge sbyong nor ni gsog tu gyur //
translated: The wealth of the spiritual practitioner is to be accumulated.

original: brtson 'grus nyams pa'i le lo can //
analyzed: brtson 'grus nyams pa'i le lo can //
translated: Those who are lazy and have lost their diligence,

original: tshul khrims phung por mi gnas pa //
analyzed: tshul khrims phung por mi gnas pa //
translated: Do not abide in the aggregate of discipline,

original: kun nas langs pas smra ba ni //
analyzed: kun nas langs pas smra ba ni //
translated: And speak with a sense of self-importance,

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas bshad ma yin //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas bshad ma yin //
translated: This is not the teaching of the Buddha.

analyzed: chos smra ba po'i le'u'i mdo las kyang /

analyzed: ngas ji ltar bya snyam du dbugs ring du nang du rngub cing brngub par bya'o zhes gsungs so //

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kun dga' bo la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //

original: shes bzhin med pa /
analyzed: shes bzhin med pa /

analyzed: spyod lam mi sdug pa /

analyzed: lag na 'khar ba thogs pa /

analyzed: kun dga' bo de ltar de'i tshe nga'i bstan pa 'di ba ltar mi rung ba dang / mnyan du mi rung bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa na /

analyzed: dge sbyong goo ta ma nga la khros so zhes sems te /

analyzed: kun dga' bo bdud kyi las 'di dag 'khor bzhi po rnams la yang dang yang du shod cig / de ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: kun dga' bo dge slong gang dag mdo'i tshig 'di la mngon par brtson pa de la /

original: sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: You should know that it is the word of the Buddha.

original: bdud kyis smras pa'i mdo sde dang 'dul ba tshad mar byed pa'i sems can gang yin pa de dag ni /
analyzed: bdud kyis smras pa'i mdo sde dang 'dul ba tshad mar byed pa'i sems can gang yin pa de dag ni /
translated: Those who take as authoritative the sūtras and vinaya spoken by Māra

original: bdud dang mthun par byed pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bdud dang mthun par byed pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: should be known as those who side with Māra.

original: sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa'i mdo sde dang 'dul ba tshad mar byed pa gang yin pa de dag ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa'i mdo sde dang 'dul ba tshad mar byed pa gang yin pa de dag ni /
translated: Those who take as authoritative the sūtras and vinaya spoken by the Buddha

original: byang chub sems dpa' yin par rig par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' yin par rig par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: should be known as bodhisattvas.

original: dam pa'i chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: The Sūtra on the Application of Mindfulness to the Holy Dharma also says,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: “It is like this:

original: rtsod byed ces bya ba'i bdud dang / gnyis pa g-yeng byed ces bya ba'i bdud kyi ris ni /
analyzed: rtsod byed ces bya ba'i bdud dang / gnyis pa g-yeng byed ces bya ba'i bdud kyi ris ni /
translated: The māra called Quarrelsome and the māra class called Distracting

original: gang sems can chos la spyod pa rnams sems rnam par g-yeng bar byed /
analyzed: gang sems can chos la spyod pa rnams sems rnam par g-yeng bar byed /
translated: distract the minds of sentient beings who are practicing the Dharma.

original: dam pa'i chos nyan pa na gnyid bro bar byed do //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos nyan pa na gnyid bro bar byed do //
translated: When they listen to the holy Dharma, they make them sleepy.

original: 'dod pa lhag par rmongs byed ces bya ba ni gsum pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa lhag par rmongs byed ces bya ba ni gsum pa ste /
translated: The māra called Deluded by Sensual Pleasures is the third.

original: gang sbyin pa dag gtong ba ni sbyin pa po'i sbyin bdag rnams kyi sems la /
analyzed: gang sbyin pa dag gtong ba ni sbyin pa po'i sbyin bdag rnams kyi sems la /
translated: Those who give gifts generate attachment in the minds of givers and patrons,

original: gal te bdag gis dge sbyong dang / bram ze dang / rje'u rigs su gyur pa rnams la byin pa na /
analyzed: gal te bdag gis dge sbyong dang / bram ze dang / rje'u rigs su gyur pa rnams la byin pa na /
translated: thinking, “If I give to ascetics and brahmins,

original: nga'i bu dang bu mo ci zhig za ci zhig gyon snyam du chags pa skyed par byed do //
analyzed: nga'i bu dang bu mo ci zhig za ci zhig gyon snyam du chags pa skyed par byed do //
translated: what will my sons and daughters eat? What will they wear?”

original: 'jig rten skyong ba bdud kyi rigs gsum po de ni /
analyzed: 'jig rten skyong ba bdud kyi rigs gsum po de ni /
translated: These three types of world protectors who are of the Mara type

original: sems can rnams rmongs par byed cing 'jig rten du rgyu'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams rmongs par byed cing 'jig rten du rgyu'o //
translated: wander in the world, confusing sentient beings.

original: bzhi pa rnam pa sna tshogs 'du shes zhes bya ba bdud kyi rigs 'jig rten skyong ba 'jig rten na spyod de /
analyzed: bzhi pa rnam pa sna tshogs 'du shes zhes bya ba bdud kyi rigs 'jig rten skyong ba 'jig rten na spyod de /
translated: The fourth type is called the “perception of variety.” This type of world protector who is of the Mara type wanders in the world.

original: de rab tu byung ba rnams kyi rab tu byung ba'i sems gzhan du byed de /
analyzed: de rab tu byung ba rnams kyi rab tu byung ba'i sems gzhan du byed de /
translated: They cause the minds of those who have gone forth to stray from the mind of going forth.

original: thog mar chags pa dang sbyor ba dang grong du 'jug pa dang / zong gi nyo tshong dang bud med la blta ba dang chang 'tshong ma'i khyim du 'jug pa dang / 'thab mo dang / spu ba dang / dge 'dun 'byed pa dang sems la gnod pa'i rmi lam skyed par byed do //
analyzed: thog mar chags pa dang sbyor ba dang grong du 'jug pa dang / zong gi nyo tshong dang bud med la blta ba dang chang 'tshong ma'i khyim du 'jug pa dang / 'thab mo dang / spu ba dang / dge 'dun 'byed pa dang sems la gnod pa'i rmi lam skyed par byed do //
translated: First, he generates attachment, then he generates the preparations, then he generates the entry into the village, then he generates the buying and selling of goods, then he generates the looking at women, then he generates the entry into the house of the wine merchant, then he generates the quarrel, then he generates the shaving of the head, then he generates the splitting of the Saṅgha, and then he generates the dream that harms the mind.

original: bdud kyi ris @77b 'jig rten skyong ba bzhi po de dag ni /
analyzed: bdud kyi ris @77b 'jig rten skyong ba bzhi po de dag ni /
translated: These four world protectors of the class of Māra

original: gang gi tshe 'jam bu'i gling na chos ma yin pa smra ba'i skye  bo yod pa'i tshe nus par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'jam bu'i gling na chos ma yin pa smra ba'i skye  bo yod pa'i tshe nus par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: are able to do this when there are people in Jambudvīpa who speak non-Dharma.

original: bdud kyi 'gying bag gi mdo las kyang /
analyzed: bdud kyi 'gying bag gi mdo las kyang /
translated: The Sūtra on Māra’s Arrogance also says,

original: nyi shu po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi 'dud kyi las lhag par gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: nyi shu po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi 'dud kyi las lhag par gyur pa yin te /
translated: “These twenty are the bodhisattvas’ activities that surpass Māra:

original: nyi shu dag gang zhe na /
analyzed: nyi shu dag gang zhe na /
translated: What are the twenty?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: rnam par grol ba 'dod pa nyid kyis 'khor bas skrag pa rnal 'byor spyod pa rnams la bsnyen pa dang / bsten pa dang bsnyen bkur byed pa ni bdud kyi las so //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba 'dod pa nyid kyis 'khor bas skrag pa rnal 'byor spyod pa rnams la bsnyen pa dang / bsten pa dang bsnyen bkur byed pa ni bdud kyi las so //
translated: It is a deed of Mara if a yogi, out of a desire for liberation, becomes attached to the teachings of the Sravakas and Pratyekabuddhas.

original: stong pa nyid la so sor rtog cing sems can rnams yal bar 'dor ba ni bdud kyi las so //🔽'dus ma byas la so sor rtog cing /
analyzed: stong pa nyid la so sor rtog cing sems can rnams yal bar 'dor ba ni bdud kyi las so // 'dus ma byas la so sor rtog cing /
translated: It is a deed of Mara if one, while contemplating emptiness, abandons sentient beings.

original: 'dus byas kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba la skyo ba ni bdud kyi las so //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba la skyo ba ni bdud kyi las so //
translated: It is a deed of Mara if one, while contemplating the uncompounded, becomes weary of the compounded roots of virtue.

original: bsam gtan skyed par byed cing bsam gtan gyis 'tsho ba yongs su tshol ba ni bdud kyi las so //
analyzed: bsam gtan skyed par byed cing bsam gtan gyis 'tsho ba yongs su tshol ba ni bdud kyi las so //
translated: It is a deed of Mara if one, while generating the dhyanas, seeks to live by the dhyanas.

original: chos ston par byed cing chos nyan pa rnams la snying rje mi 'jug pa ni bdud kyi las so //
analyzed: chos ston par byed cing chos nyan pa rnams la snying rje mi 'jug pa ni bdud kyi las so //
translated: It is a deed of Mara if one, while teaching the Dharma, does not feel compassion for those who listen to the Dharma.

original: tshul khrims dang yon tan chol bar byed cing tshul khrims 'chal pa rnams la khro ba ni bdud kyi las so //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang yon tan chol bar byed cing tshul khrims 'chal pa rnams la khro ba ni bdud kyi las so //
translated: It is a deed of Mara if one, while praising morality and good qualities, becomes angry at those who have faulty morality.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi gtam rjod par byed cing /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi gtam rjod par byed cing /
translated: It is a deed of Mara if one recites the teachings of the Sravakas and Pratyekabuddhas.

original: theg pa chen po'i gtam 'chab par byed pa ni bdud kyi las so //
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i gtam 'chab par byed pa ni bdud kyi las so //
translated: Concealing the teachings of the Great Vehicle is the work of Māra.

original: zab mo'i gtan 'chab par byed cing /
analyzed: zab mo'i gtan 'chab par byed cing /
translated: Concealing the profound teachings,

original: sna tshogs pa'i gtam rjod par byed pa ni bdud kyi las so //
analyzed: sna tshogs pa'i gtam rjod par byed pa ni bdud kyi las so //
translated: and expounding various kinds of teachings, is the work of Māra.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i lam la dam 'cha' zhing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i lam la dam 'cha' zhing /
translated: Vowing to follow the bodhisattva path,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa'i lam mi tshol ba ni bdud kyi las so //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa'i lam mi tshol ba ni bdud kyi las so //
translated: but not seeking the path of the perfections, is the work of Māra.

original: mngon par brtson pa'i bsngags pa smra bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: mngon par brtson pa'i bsngags pa smra bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: Praising those who are diligent,

original: mngon par mi brtson pa'i sems can sems can rnams mngon par sbyor bar mi byed pa ni bdud kyi las so //
analyzed: mngon par mi brtson pa'i sems can sems can rnams mngon par sbyor bar mi byed pa ni bdud kyi las so //
translated: but not engaging in the practice of those sentient beings who are not diligent, is the work of Māra.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba nye bar gsog cing /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba nye bar gsog cing /
translated: Accumulating roots of virtue,

original: byang chub sems dpa' la rgyab kyi phyogs pa ni bdud kyi las so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' la rgyab kyi phyogs pa ni bdud kyi las so //
translated: but turning one’s back on the bodhisattvas, is the work of Māra.

original: lhag mthong gi rnal 'byor la rjes su brtson par gnas shing /
analyzed: lhag mthong gi rnal 'byor la rjes su brtson par gnas shing /
translated: Dedicating oneself to the practice of insight,

original: sems can la lhag mthong yang dag par 'dzin du mi 'jug pa ni bdud kyi las so //
analyzed: sems can la lhag mthong yang dag par 'dzin du mi 'jug pa ni bdud kyi las so //
translated: but not encouraging sentient beings to take up insight, is the work of Māra.

original: ma lus par zad par mi tshol zhing /
analyzed: ma lus par zad par mi tshol zhing /
translated: Not seeking to put an end to all afflictions,

original: 'khor ba'i nyon mongs pa'i rgyun dag la mi spyod pa ni bdud kyi las so //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i nyon mongs pa'i rgyun dag la mi spyod pa ni bdud kyi las so //
translated: Not to practice the stream of the afflictions of saṃsāra is the work of Māra.

original: shes rab la rnam par spyod cing /
analyzed: shes rab la rnam par spyod cing /
translated: To practice wisdom

original: snying rje chen po'i dmigs pa mi 'dzin pa ni bdud kyi las so //
analyzed: snying rje chen po'i dmigs pa mi 'dzin pa ni bdud kyi las so //
translated: but not to hold the object of great compassion as the focus is the work of Māra.

original: mkhan po dang mi ldan pa'i dge ba'i spyod pa thams cad ni bdud kyi las so //
analyzed: mkhan po dang mi ldan pa'i dge ba'i spyod pa thams cad ni bdud kyi las so //
translated: All virtuous practices that are not accompanied by a spiritual friend are the work of Māra.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod don du mi gnyer @78a * //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod don du mi gnyer @78a * //
translated: Not to strive for the Bodhisattva canon

original: zhing ; rgyang 'phen pa'i gsang tshig 'dzin pa ni bdud kyi las so //
analyzed: zhing ; rgyang 'phen pa'i gsang tshig 'dzin pa ni bdud kyi las so //
translated: and to hold the secret words of the Lokāyatas is the work of Māra.

original: mang du thos pa'i chos kyi dme mkhyud gzhan gyis shes pa re snyam pa ni bdud kyi las so //
analyzed: mang du thos pa'i chos kyi dme mkhyud gzhan gyis shes pa re snyam pa ni bdud kyi las so //
translated: To be stingy with the Dharma of the learned, thinking, “Others should know it,” is the work of Māra.

original: 'jig rten pa'i bya bas g-yengs shing /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i bya bas g-yengs shing /
translated: To be distracted by worldly activities

original: mang du thos pa don du mi gnyer pa ni bdud kyi las so //
analyzed: mang du thos pa don du mi gnyer pa ni bdud kyi las so //
translated: and not to strive for learning is the work of Māra.

original: byang chub sems dpa' chos smra ba po theg pa chen po la yang dag par gnas pa mi bsten mi bsnyen mi bkur cing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chos smra ba po theg pa chen po la yang dag par gnas pa mi bsten mi bsnyen mi bkur cing /
translated: A bodhisattva does not rely on, serve, or honor a Dharma teacher who is established in the Great Vehicle.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la yang dag par gnas pa skal pa mi mnyam pa rnams dang lhan cig dga' ba ni bdud kyi las so //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la yang dag par gnas pa skal pa mi mnyam pa rnams dang lhan cig dga' ba ni bdud kyi las so //
translated: It is a deed of Māra to delight in the company of those who are not equal in terms of the vehicle, such as those who are devoted to the vehicles of the hearers and solitary buddhas.

original: gang gi tshe brgya byin nam /
analyzed: gang gi tshe brgya byin nam /
translated: When you become like Śakra,

original: tshangs pa'am / 'jig rten skyod pa'am /
analyzed: tshangs pa'am / 'jig rten skyod pa'am /
translated: Brahmā, or a world protector,

original: rgyal po'am / tshod dpon nam /🔽khyim bdag gi longs spyod dam /
analyzed: rgyal po'am / tshod dpon nam / khyim bdag gi longs spyod dam /
translated: a king, a merchant,

original: nor dang rin po che dang / dbang phyug gis che ba nyid du gyur pa /
analyzed: nor dang rin po che dang / dbang phyug gis che ba nyid du gyur pa /
translated: or a householder with wealth, jewels, and power,

original: de'i tshe chos kyis che ba nyid dang ldan pa rnams la mi bsten /
analyzed: de'i tshe chos kyis che ba nyid dang ldan pa rnams la mi bsten /
translated: at that time you will not rely on those who are great in terms of the Dharma,

original: mi bsnyen bsnyen bkur mi byed pa ste /
analyzed: mi bsnyen bsnyen bkur mi byed pa ste /
translated: you will not serve them or venerate them.

original: lha'i bu nyi shu po 'di dag ni /
analyzed: lha'i bu nyi shu po 'di dag ni /
translated: These twenty sons of gods

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bdud kyi las lhag pa yin no zhes gsungs so /🔽// / nyo tshong la dgongs pa bstan pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bdud kyi las lhag pa yin no zhes gsungs so / // / nyo tshong la dgongs pa bstan pa /
translated: are the bodhisattvas’ deeds of Māra.”

original: dgag dbye'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: dgag dbye'i mdo las kyang /
translated: The Sūtra on the Ritual for the Invitation of the Buddhas also says:

original: tshod pa'i sbyor la dga' ba la dgag dbye yod pa ma yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: tshod pa'i sbyor la dga' ba la dgag dbye yod pa ma yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: “There is no invitation ritual for those who delight in the preparations for a sacrifice.”

original: yul 'khor skyong gi mdo las kyang //
analyzed: yul 'khor skyong gi mdo las kyang //
translated: The Rāṣṭrapāla Sūtra also says:🔽They will always be disrespectful

original: 'phags pa bla ma rnams dang pha ma la //
analyzed: 'phags pa bla ma rnams dang pha ma la //
translated: to the noble gurus and their parents.🔽Ungrateful and deceitful,

original: de dag rtag tu gus pa med par 'gyur //🔽de dag byas pa mi gzo g-yo can te //🔽rtag tu kun du ma bsdams spyod cing rmongs //
analyzed: de dag rtag tu gus pa med par 'gyur // de dag byas pa mi gzo g-yo can te // rtag tu kun du ma bsdams spyod cing rmongs //
translated: they will always be unrestrained, ignorant,

original: rnyed la rtag tu chags shing zhen pa ste //
analyzed: rnyed la rtag tu chags shing zhen pa ste //
translated: and attached to and fixated on possessions.

original: de dag tshul 'chos pa dang g-yo sbyor dga' //
analyzed: de dag tshul 'chos pa dang g-yo sbyor dga' //
translated: They will delight in hypocrisy and deceit.

original: kha cig tshul khrims brtul zhugs ci ltas kyang //
analyzed: kha cig tshul khrims brtul zhugs ci ltas kyang //
translated: Some, though they have the discipline of ascetics,

original: 'di na bdag dang mtshungs pa med ces smra //
analyzed: 'di na bdag dang mtshungs pa med ces smra //
translated: will say, “There is no one equal to me.”

original: de dag phan tshun sdang bar sems pa ste //
analyzed: de dag phan tshun sdang bar sems pa ste //
translated: They will be hostile to one another

original: glags tshol ba la rtag tu brtson pa yin //
analyzed: glags tshol ba la rtag tu brtson pa yin //
translated: and will always strive to find an opportunity to harm one another.

original: de dag zhing gi las dang tshod la dga' //
analyzed: de dag zhing gi las dang tshod la dga' //
translated: They will delight in farming and commerce

original: de dag dge sbyong dga' bstan shin tu ring //
analyzed: de dag dge sbyong dga' bstan shin tu ring //
translated: and will be far from the teachings of the virtuous.

original: phyi ma'i dus na 'di ltar ma bsdams pa'i //
analyzed: phyi ma'i dus na 'di ltar ma bsdams pa'i //
translated: In the future, unrestrained monks

original: dge slong tshul khrims yon tan rab ring ba //
analyzed: dge slong tshul khrims yon tan rab ring ba //
translated: will be far from the virtues of discipline.

original: de dag mtshang 'drub dang 'thab pa dang // phrag dog dbang gi gis nga'i  chos nub par byed //
analyzed: de dag mtshang 'drub dang 'thab pa dang // phrag dog dbang gi gis nga'i  chos nub par byed //
translated: They will destroy my Dharma through slander, fighting, and jealousy.

original: byang chub lam las rtag par shin tu ring //
analyzed: byang chub lam las rtag par shin tu ring //
translated: They will be very far from the path to enlightenment.

original: 'phags pa'i nor bu dag las shin tu ring //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i nor bu dag las shin tu ring //
translated: They will be very far from the jewels of the noble ones.

original: 'phags lam gya nom rnam par spang ma  nas ni //
analyzed: 'phags lam gya nom rnam par spang ma  nas ni //
translated: Having abandoned the excellent path of the noble ones,

original: de dag 'gro ba ltar @78b ni khyam par 'gyur //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de dag 'gro ba ltar @78b ni khyam par 'gyur // zhes gsungs so //
translated: they will wander in the cycle of existence.

original: snying rje chen po la 'jug pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: snying rje chen po la 'jug pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: The Sūtra on Entering Great Compassion also says:

original: rnal 'byor mi brtson mtshan nyid 'di yin te //
analyzed: rnal 'byor mi brtson mtshan nyid 'di yin te //
translated: This is the characteristic of one who does not strive in yoga:

original: gzhan gyi bud med rnams la rtag tu chags //
analyzed: gzhan gyi bud med rnams la rtag tu chags //
translated: They are always attached to the wives of others.

original: gzugs kyis rgyags shing bcings pa med par 'gyur //
analyzed: gzugs kyis rgyags shing bcings pa med par 'gyur //
translated: They are intoxicated by beauty and become unrestrained.

original: grong dang grong rnal yul 'khor dag tu 'khyam//
analyzed: grong dang grong rnal yul 'khor dag tu 'khyam//
translated: They wander in towns, villages, and countries.

original: de dag bza' dang btung la rtag tu brtson //
analyzed: de dag bza' dang btung la rtag tu brtson //
translated: They are always striving for food and drink.

original: gar dang glu dang de bzhin rol mo dang // nyo dang tshong la rtag tu spro bar 'gyur //
analyzed: gar dang glu dang de bzhin rol mo dang // nyo dang tshong la rtag tu spro bar 'gyur //
translated: They are always enthusiastic about dancing, singing, and music,

original: btung ba la yang chags shing ngo tsha nyams //
analyzed: btung ba la yang chags shing ngo tsha nyams //
translated: buying and selling, and are attached to drinking and shameless.

original: tshul khrims de bzhin spyod la mdor nas ni //
analyzed: tshul khrims de bzhin spyod la mdor nas ni //
translated: In brief, those who do not practice ethics

original: rnal 'byor mi brtson phrin yig 'khyer bar byed //
analyzed: rnal 'byor mi brtson phrin yig 'khyer bar byed //
translated: are not yogis, but messengers carrying letters.

original: khyim pa dang ni lhan cig lugs bcom nas //
analyzed: khyim pa dang ni lhan cig lugs bcom nas //
translated: They destroy the rules of conduct by associating with householders.

original: tshul nyams de dag yang dag min la gnas //
analyzed: tshul nyams de dag yang dag min la gnas //
translated: Those who violate ethics are not genuine.

original: las gang rtag tu sangs rgyas kyi smad pa //
analyzed: las gang rtag tu sangs rgyas kyi smad pa //
translated: The actions that the Buddha always criticized

original: srang dang 'jal ba'i zol la rtag tu brtson //
analyzed: srang dang 'jal ba'i zol la rtag tu brtson //
translated: are always being pursued through the pretense of weights and measures.

original: nyon mongs sdig pa'i las de dag byas nas //
analyzed: nyon mongs sdig pa'i las de dag byas nas //
translated: Having committed those actions of afflictions and misdeeds,

original: las nyams nas ni ngan song 'gro bar 'gyur //🔽zhes gsungs so /
analyzed: las nyams nas ni ngan song 'gro bar 'gyur // zhes gsungs so /
translated: they fall from their actions and go to the lower realms.

original: spyod yul yongs su dag pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: spyod yul yongs su dag pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: It says in the Sūtra of Pure Conduct:

original: 'jig rten pa'i gtam la mi blta bar bya /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i gtam la mi blta bar bya /
translated: Do not look at worldly talk.

original: nyo tshong gi tha snyad las ldog par bya /
analyzed: nyo tshong gi tha snyad las ldog par bya /
translated: Turn away from the conventions of buying and selling.

original: sman dpyad dang snyan dngags dang gtam rgyud la mngon par dga' ba dang / rgyal po la mngon par dga' ba dang / khyim gyi las kyi mtha' la yang dag par brtson par mi bya /
analyzed: sman dpyad dang snyan dngags dang gtam rgyud la mngon par dga' ba dang / rgyal po la mngon par dga' ba dang / khyim gyi las kyi mtha' la yang dag par brtson par mi bya /
translated: Do not delight in medicine, poetry, and stories, delight in the king, or strive in household activities.

original: 'dug pa dang ldang pa dang / 'chag pa dang nyal ba la mkhas par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dug pa dang ldang pa dang / 'chag pa dang nyal ba la mkhas par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: You should be skilled in sitting, rising, walking, and lying down.

original: tshul khrims 'chal pa'i mtshan ma la dgongs pa bstan pa /
analyzed: tshul khrims 'chal pa'i mtshan ma la dgongs pa bstan pa /
translated: The teaching on the signs of immorality

original: dkon mchog brtsegs pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: dkon mchog brtsegs pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: The Ratnakuṭa Sūtra says,

original: 'od srungs bzhi po 'di dag ni dge sbyong ste /
analyzed: 'od srungs bzhi po 'di dag ni dge sbyong ste /
translated: Kāśyapa, there are four kinds of monks.

original: bzhi  na /
analyzed: bzhi  na /
translated: What are the four?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are

original: kha dog dang rtags dang dbyibs kyi dge sbyong dang / cho ga srung zhing tshul 'chos pa'i dge sbyong dang / brjod pa'i sgra tshigs su bcad pa'i dge sbyong dang / yang dag par sgrub pa'i dge sbyong ngo //
analyzed: kha dog dang rtags dang dbyibs kyi dge sbyong dang / cho ga srung zhing tshul 'chos pa'i dge sbyong dang / brjod pa'i sgra tshigs su bcad pa'i dge sbyong dang / yang dag par sgrub pa'i dge sbyong ngo //
translated: monks who are like the color white, monks who are like the color of a conch, monks who are like a cloud, and monks who are like a lion.

original: 'od srungs de la kha dog dang rtags dang dbyibs kyi dge sbyong gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'od srungs de la kha dog dang rtags dang dbyibs kyi dge sbyong gang zhe na /
translated: Kāśyapa, what is a monk who is like the color white?

original: 'od srungs 'di la dge sbyong kha cig kha dog dang / rtags dang dbyibs dang ldan par gyur te /
analyzed: 'od srungs 'di la dge sbyong kha cig kha dog dang / rtags dang dbyibs dang ldan par gyur te /
translated: Kāśyapa, it is like this: some monks have the color, signs, and appearance of monks.

original: chos gos snam sbyar gyon cing /
analyzed: chos gos snam sbyar gyon cing /
translated: They wear the robes of monks.

original: mgo bregs te lhung bzed thog sa mod kyi /
analyzed: mgo bregs te lhung bzed thog sa mod kyi /
translated: They shave their heads and faces.

original: de lus kyi las yongs su ma dag par spyod /
analyzed: de lus kyi las yongs su ma dag par spyod /
translated: They engage in physical actions that are not completely pure.

original: ngag gi las yongs su ma dag par spyod /
analyzed: ngag gi las yongs su ma dag par spyod /
translated: They engage in verbal actions that are not completely pure.

original: yid kyi las yongs su ma dag par spyod cing /
analyzed: yid kyi las yongs su ma dag par spyod cing /
translated: They engage in mental actions that are not completely pure.

original: @79a * // ma dul ba ma zhi ba /
analyzed: @79a * // ma dul ba ma zhi ba /
translated: They are undisciplined, not peaceful,

original: ma bsrungs pa ma byung ba /
analyzed: ma bsrungs pa ma byung ba /
translated: not restrained, and not collected.

original: 'tsho ba yongs su ma dag par brkam pa /🔽le lo can tshul khrims 'chal ba /
analyzed: 'tsho ba yongs su ma dag par brkam pa / le lo can tshul khrims 'chal ba /
translated: They are greedy, with impure livelihoods.

original: sdig pa'i chos can yin te /
analyzed: sdig pa'i chos can yin te /
translated: They are lazy, immoral, and have sinful qualities.

original: 'od srungs de ni kha dog dang / rtags dang dbyibs kyi dge sbyor zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'od srungs de ni kha dog dang / rtags dang dbyibs kyi dge sbyor zhes bya'o //
translated: Kāśyapa, that is called the spiritual practice of color, signs, and shape.

original: 'od srungs 'di la cho ga srung zhing tshul 'chos pa'i dge sbyong gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'od srungs 'di la cho ga srung zhing tshul 'chos pa'i dge sbyong gang zhe na /
translated: “Kāśyapa, what is a spiritual practitioner who observes ritual and is a hypocrite?

original: 'od srungs 'di la dge sbyong kha cig cho ga dang / spyod yul dang / spyod pa phun sum tshogs shing /
analyzed: 'od srungs 'di la dge sbyong kha cig cho ga dang / spyod yul dang / spyod pa phun sum tshogs shing /
translated: Kāśyapa, some spiritual practitioners are perfect in their conduct, sphere of activity, and behavior.

original: spyod lam bzhir shes bzhin du spyod la zas dang skam ngan pa za zhing 'thud /
analyzed: spyod lam bzhir shes bzhin du spyod la zas dang skam ngan pa za zhing 'thud /
translated: They are aware of the four modes of conduct and eat and drink poor-quality food and drink.

original: 'phags pa'i rigs bzhi po dag gis chog par 'dzin pa pa sa  mtha'i gnas mal la mngon par dga' zhing /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i rigs bzhi po dag gis chog par 'dzin pa pa sa  mtha'i gnas mal la mngon par dga' zhing /
translated: They are content with the four noble families and delight in the final resting place.

original: khyim pa dang rab tu byung ba rnams dang mi 'dre la /
analyzed: khyim pa dang rab tu byung ba rnams dang mi 'dre la /
translated: They do not mix with householders or renunciates.

original: tshig nyung zhing smra ba nyung mod kyi /
analyzed: tshig nyung zhing smra ba nyung mod kyi /
translated: They have few words and speak little.

original: de'i spyod lam de dag kyang tshul 'chos pa dang / kha gsag gis yongs su brtag pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i spyod lam de dag kyang tshul 'chos pa dang / kha gsag gis yongs su brtag pa yin te /
translated: But their conduct is contrived and exaggerated,

original: sems yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir ma yin /
analyzed: sems yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir ma yin /
translated: not for the sake of purifying the mind,

original: dul bar bya ba'i phyir ma yin /
analyzed: dul bar bya ba'i phyir ma yin /
translated: not for the sake of self-discipline,

original: nye bar zhi par bya ba'i tshul ma yin gyi dmigs par lta ba yin te /
analyzed: nye bar zhi par bya ba'i tshul ma yin gyi dmigs par lta ba yin te /
translated: not for the sake of peace. They view things as objects.

original: ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga yi ra 'dzin pa la gnas shing /
analyzed: ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga yi ra 'dzin pa la gnas shing /
translated: They abide in the grasping of “I” and “mine.”

original: stong pa nyid kyis mi dmigs pa'i chos rnams la g-yang sar yang 'du shes pa yin /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyis mi dmigs pa'i chos rnams la g-yang sar yang 'du shes pa yin /
translated: They perceive emptiness and the unobservable phenomena as a precipice.

original: stong pa nyid smra ba'i dge slong rnams la yang dgrar 'du shes pa yin te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid smra ba'i dge slong rnams la yang dgrar 'du shes pa yin te /
translated: They perceive the monks who teach emptiness as enemies.

original: 'od srungs de ni cho ga srung zhing tshul 'chos pa'i dge sbyong zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'od srungs de ni cho ga srung zhing tshul 'chos pa'i dge sbyong zhes bya'o //
translated: Kāśyapa, that is called the monk who observes ritual and hypocrisy.

original: 'od srungs de la brjod pa'i sgra tshigs su bcad pa'i dge sbyong gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'od srungs de la brjod pa'i sgra tshigs su bcad pa'i dge sbyong gang zhe na /
translated: Kāśyapa, what is the monk who is a poet?

original: 'od srungs 'di la dge sbyong kha cig ji ltar bdag tshul khrims dang ldan par gzhan gyi shes par 'gyur snyam du so sor brtags nas tshul khrims srung /
analyzed: 'od srungs 'di la dge sbyong kha cig ji ltar bdag tshul khrims dang ldan par gzhan gyi shes par 'gyur snyam du so sor brtags nas tshul khrims srung /
translated: Kāśyapa, here some monks, thinking, “How can others know that I am moral?” observe morality.

original: ji ltar mang du thos par gzhan gyis shes par 'gyur snyam du so sor brtags nas thos pa 'dzin /
analyzed: ji ltar mang du thos par gzhan gyis shes par 'gyur snyam du so sor brtags nas thos pa 'dzin /
translated: Thinking, “How can others know that I am learned?” they memorize teachings.

original: ji ltar bdag dgon par gzhan gyis shes par 'gyur snyam du so sor brtags nas 'dod pa nyung la chog shes pa dang / rab tu dben par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji ltar bdag dgon par gzhan gyis shes par 'gyur snyam du so sor brtags nas 'dod pa nyung la chog shes pa dang / rab tu dben par 'gyur te /
translated: Thinking, “How can others know that I am secluded?” they have few desires and are content, and they are secluded.

original: 'di ltar gzhan la bstan pa'i phyir yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhan la bstan pa'i phyir yin gyi /
translated: It is like this: it is for the sake of teaching others,

original: skyo bar bya ba'i phyir ma yin /
analyzed: skyo bar bya ba'i phyir ma yin /
translated: not for the sake of disenchantment,

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir ma yin /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir ma yin /
translated: not for the sake of freedom from attachment,

original: 'gog par bya ba'i phyir ma yin /
analyzed: 'gog par bya ba'i phyir ma yin /
translated: not for the sake of cessation,

original: nye bar zhi bar bya ba'i phyir ma yin /
analyzed: nye bar zhi bar bya ba'i phyir ma yin /
translated: not for the sake of peace,

original: rdzogs par byang chub par  bya ba'i phyir ma yin /
analyzed: rdzogs par byang chub par  bya ba'i phyir ma yin /
translated: not for the sake of perfect awakening,

original: dge sbyong gi phyir ma yin /
analyzed: dge sbyong gi phyir ma yin /
translated: not for the sake of being a renunciant,

original: tshangs pa'i phyir ma yin /
analyzed: tshangs pa'i phyir ma yin /
translated: not for the sake of being a brahmin,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i phyir ma yin /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i phyir ma yin /
translated: not for the sake of nirvāṇa,

original: 'od srungs de ni brjod pa'i sgra tshigs su bcad pa'i @79b dge sbyong zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'od srungs de ni brjod pa'i sgra tshigs su bcad pa'i @79b dge sbyong zhes bya'o //
translated: Kāśyapa, that is what is called a renunciant who is a mere sound, a mere expression, a mere verse.

original: 'od srungs de la yang dag par sgrub pa'i dge sbyong gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'od srungs de la yang dag par sgrub pa'i dge sbyong gang zhe na /
translated: “Kāśyapa, what is a renunciant who is truly accomplished?

original: 'od srungs gang lus dang srog la yang mi lta ba yin na /
analyzed: 'od srungs gang lus dang srog la yang mi lta ba yin na /
translated: Kāśyapa, one who does not even care for their body and life,

original: rnyed pa dang bkur sti dang / tshigs su bcad pa la lta ci smos /
analyzed: rnyed pa dang bkur sti dang / tshigs su bcad pa la lta ci smos /
translated: needless to say, for gain, honor, and fame.

original: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i chos rnams thos nas /
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i chos rnams thos nas /
translated: Having heard the teachings on emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness,

original: dga' zhing de bzhin du zhugs pa yin /
analyzed: dga' zhing de bzhin du zhugs pa yin /
translated: they delight in them and practice accordingly.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa la yang 'dod pa med par spyad pa spyod na /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa la yang 'dod pa med par spyad pa spyod na /
translated: If they practice without any desire for nirvāṇa,

original: khams gsum la mngon par dga' ba lta ci smos /
analyzed: khams gsum la mngon par dga' ba lta ci smos /
translated: needless to say, for delighting in the three realms.

original: stong pa nyid du lta ba yang mi 'dod pa yin na /
analyzed: stong pa nyid du lta ba yang mi 'dod pa yin na /
translated: They do not even assert the view of emptiness,

original: bdag dang sems can dang / srog dang skye ba po dang / gso ba dang skyes bu dang / gang zag tu lta ba lta ci smos /
analyzed: bdag dang sems can dang / srog dang skye ba po dang / gso ba dang skyes bu dang / gang zag tu lta ba lta ci smos /
translated: let alone the views of self, sentient being, life force, person, nourisher, and individual.

original: don la rton gyi tshig 'bru la rton pa ma yin /
analyzed: don la rton gyi tshig 'bru la rton pa ma yin /
translated: They rely on the meaning, not on the words.

original: nyon mongs pa rnams las rnam par thar pa nang du tshol gyi /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams las rnam par thar pa nang du tshol gyi /
translated: They seek liberation from the afflictions within,

original: phyi rol du rgyag pa ma yin /
analyzed: phyi rol du rgyag pa ma yin /
translated: not externally.

original: chos thams cad shin tu yongs su dag cing /
analyzed: chos thams cad shin tu yongs su dag cing /
translated: They see all phenomena as utterly pure

original: rang bzhin gyis kun nas nyon mongs pa med par mthong bas bdag nyid skyabs yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis kun nas nyon mongs pa med par mthong bas bdag nyid skyabs yin te /
translated: and naturally free from afflictions, so they take refuge in themselves,

original: gzhan skyabs ma yin /
analyzed: gzhan skyabs ma yin /
translated: not in others.

original: de de bzhin gshegs pa la chos nyid du yang mi lta na /
analyzed: de de bzhin gshegs pa la chos nyid du yang mi lta na /
translated: They do not even view the Thus-Gone One as the nature of phenomena,

original: gzugs kyi skur lta ci smos /
analyzed: gzugs kyi skur lta ci smos /
translated: let alone as a form body.

original: chos la 'dod chags dang bral bar yang mi lta na /
analyzed: chos la 'dod chags dang bral bar yang mi lta na /
translated: They do not even view phenomena as free from attachment,

original: smra ba'i tshig gi lam nas brjod par lta ci smos /
analyzed: smra ba'i tshig gi lam nas brjod par lta ci smos /
translated: let alone as expressed through the path of verbal expression.

original: 'phags pa 'dus ma byas pa'i dge 'dun la yang rnam pa rtog na /
analyzed: 'phags pa 'dus ma byas pa'i dge 'dun la yang rnam pa rtog na /
translated: They do not even conceptualize the noble unconditioned saṅgha,🔽let alone the conditioned saṅgha.

original: mang po 'dus par lta ci smos /🔽chos gang spang bar bya ba'i phyir brtson pa ma yin /
analyzed: mang po 'dus par lta ci smos / chos gang spang bar bya ba'i phyir brtson pa ma yin /
translated: What need is there to speak of a crowd?🔽He does not strive to abandon any dharma.

original: bsgom par bya ba'i phyir ma yin /🔽mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir ma yin /
analyzed: bsgom par bya ba'i phyir ma yin / mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir ma yin /
translated: He does not strive to cultivate any dharma.🔽He does not strive to actualize any dharma.

original: mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir ma yin /
analyzed: mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir ma yin /
translated: He does not strive to actualize any dharma.

original: 'khor bar yang mi skye /🔽mya ngan las 'das par yang mngon par dga' ba ma yin /
analyzed: 'khor bar yang mi skye / mya ngan las 'das par yang mngon par dga' ba ma yin /
translated: He is not reborn in cyclic existence.🔽He does not delight in nirvāṇa.

original: thar pa yang mi dmigs /
analyzed: thar pa yang mi dmigs /
translated: He does not observe liberation.

original: bcings pa la yang ma yin la /
analyzed: bcings pa la yang ma yin la /
translated: He is not bound.

original: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das par rig nas /
analyzed: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das par rig nas /
translated: Knowing that all dharmas are naturally liberated,

original: kun du mi 'khor /
analyzed: kun du mi 'khor /
translated: he does not cycle.

original: yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba yin te /
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba yin te /
translated: He does not attain nirvāṇa.

original: ming gis gnod par mi bya ste /

original: 'od srungs dge sbyong ni bzhi po 'di dag go zhes gsungs so //

translated: Kāśyapa, there are four kinds of mendicants.
