original: khyim na gnas pa ni bya sla ba'o //
analyzed: khyim na gnas pa ni bya sla ba'o //
translated: The householder is easy to do.

original: rab tu byung ba ni bya dka' ba'o //
analyzed: rab tu byung ba ni bya dka' ba'o //
translated: The renunciate is hard to do.

original: khyim na gnas pa ni rgyun phyogs su 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: khyim na gnas pa ni rgyun phyogs su 'gro ba'o //
translated: The householder goes with the stream.

original: rab tu byung ba ni rgyun las bzlog ste 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: rab tu byung ba ni rgyun las bzlog ste 'gro ba'o //
translated: The renunciate goes against the stream.

original: khyim na gnas pa ni chu bo'o //
analyzed: khyim na gnas pa ni chu bo'o //
translated: The householder is a river.

original: rab tu byung ba ni gzings so //
analyzed: rab tu byung ba ni gzings so //
translated: The renunciate is a bridge.

original: khyim na gnas pa ni nyon mongs pa'i chu bo'o //
analyzed: khyim na gnas pa ni nyon mongs pa'i chu bo'o //
translated: The householder is a river of afflictions.

original: rab tu byung ba ni zam pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu byung ba ni zam pa'o //
translated: The renunciate is a bridge.

original: khyim na gnas pa ni tshu rol gyi ngogs so //
analyzed: khyim na gnas pa ni tshu rol gyi ngogs so //
translated: “To live in a house is this shore;

original: rab tu byung ba ni pha rol gyi ngogs so //
analyzed: rab tu byung ba ni pha rol gyi ngogs so //
translated: to go forth is the further shore.

original: khyim na gnas pa ni glags pa'o //
analyzed: khyim na gnas pa ni glags pa'o //
translated: To live in a house is to be bound;

original: rab tu byung ba ni ma glags pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu byung ba ni ma glags pa'o //
translated: to go forth is to be free.

original: khyim na gnas pa ni khon du 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: khyim na gnas pa ni khon du 'dzin pa'o //
translated: To live in a house is to be full of enmity;

original: rab tu byung ba ni khon du 'dzin pa zhi ba'o //
analyzed: rab tu byung ba ni khon du 'dzin pa zhi ba'o //
translated: to go forth is to pacify enmity.

original: khyim na gnas pa ni rgyal po'i nan tur bzhin byed pa'o //
analyzed: khyim na gnas pa ni rgyal po'i nan tur bzhin byed pa'o //
translated: To live in a house is to act like a king’s prison guard;

original: rab tu byung ba ni sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa bzhin byed pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu byung ba ni sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa bzhin byed pa'o //
translated: to go forth is to act like the Buddha’s disciple.

original: khyim na gnas pa ni nyam thag pa'o //
analyzed: khyim na gnas pa ni nyam thag pa'o //
translated: To live in a house is to be in distress;

original: rab tu byung ba ni nyam thag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu byung ba ni nyam thag pa med pa'o //
translated: to go forth is to be without distress.

original: khyim na gnas pa ni sdug bsngal 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: khyim na gnas pa ni sdug bsngal 'byung ba'o //
translated: To live in a house is to be in pain;

original: rab tu byung ba ni bde ba 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: rab tu byung ba ni bde ba 'byung ba'o //
translated: to go forth is to be without pain.

original: khyim na gnas pa ni sgang bu'o //
analyzed: khyim na gnas pa ni sgang bu'o //
translated: To live in a house is to be on high ground;

original: rab tu byung ba ni zab pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu byung ba ni zab pa'o //
translated: to go forth is to be in a deep ravine.

original: khyim na gnas pa ni grogs mang ba'o //
analyzed: khyim na gnas pa ni grogs mang ba'o //
translated: To live in a house is to have many friends;

original: rab tu byung ba ni grogs dkon pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu byung ba ni grogs dkon pa'o //
translated: to go forth is to have few friends.

original: khyim na gnas pa ni chung ma dang 'grogs pa'o //
analyzed: khyim na gnas pa ni chung ma dang 'grogs pa'o //
translated: “Living in a house is to live with a wife.

original: rab tu byung ba ni mos pa dang 'grogs pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu byung ba ni mos pa dang 'grogs pa'o //
translated: Going forth is to live with a spiritual teacher.

original: khyim na gnas pa ni rgya dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: khyim na gnas pa ni rgya dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: Living in a house is to be like a fish-trap.

original: rab tu byung ba ni rgya bral ba'o //
analyzed: rab tu byung ba ni rgya bral ba'o //
translated: Going forth is to be free from a fish-trap.

original: khyim na gnas pa ni gzhan la gnod pa byed pa gces su rtsi ba'o //🔽rab tu @92a * //
analyzed: khyim na gnas pa ni gzhan la gnod pa byed pa gces su rtsi ba'o // rab tu @92a * //
translated: Living in a house is to cherish doing harm to others.

original: byung ba ni gzhan la phan 'dogs pa gces su rtsi ba'o //
analyzed: byung ba ni gzhan la phan 'dogs pa gces su rtsi ba'o //
translated: Going forth is to cherish doing good to others.

original: khyim na gnas pa ni zang zing gi sbyin pa ched cher 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: khyim na gnas pa ni zang zing gi sbyin pa ched cher 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Living in a house is to cherish the giving of material things.

original: rab tu byung ba ni chos kyi sbyin pa ched cher 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu byung ba ni chos kyi sbyin pa ched cher 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Going forth is to cherish the giving of the Dharma.

original: khyim na gnas pa ni bdud kyi rgyal mtshan 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: khyim na gnas pa ni bdud kyi rgyal mtshan 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Living in a house is to hold up Māra’s banner.

original: rab tu byung ba ni sangs rgyas kyi rgyal mtshan 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu byung ba ni sangs rgyas kyi rgyal mtshan 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Going forth is to hold up the Buddha’s banner.

original: khyim na gnas pa ni sdug bsngal gyi gzhi'o //
analyzed: khyim na gnas pa ni sdug bsngal gyi gzhi'o //
translated: Living in a house is the basis of suffering.

original: rab tu byung ba ni sdug bsngal gyi gzhi yang dag par 'joms pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu byung ba ni sdug bsngal gyi gzhi yang dag par 'joms pa'o //
translated: Going forth is the basis for the destruction of suffering.

original: khyim na gnas pa ni phung po 'phel ba'o //
analyzed: khyim na gnas pa ni phung po 'phel ba'o //
translated: Living in a house is the basis for the increase of the aggregates.

original: rab tu byung ba ni phung po thams cad nges par 'dor ba'o //
analyzed: rab tu byung ba ni phung po thams cad nges par 'dor ba'o //
translated: Ordination is the definite rejection of all the aggregates.

original: khyim na gnas pa ni thibs po'o //
analyzed: khyim na gnas pa ni thibs po'o //
translated: Living in a home is a thicket.

original: rab tu byung ba ni thibs po las thar pa yin te /
analyzed: rab tu byung ba ni thibs po las thar pa yin te /
translated: Ordination is freedom from the thicket.

original: khyim bdag de ltar byang chub sems dpa' khyim pas rab tu byung ba la gzhol bar bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: khyim bdag de ltar byang chub sems dpa' khyim pas rab tu byung ba la gzhol bar bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: Householder, in this way, a lay bodhisattva should incline toward ordination.

original: rin po che'i tog las kyang /
analyzed: rin po che'i tog las kyang /
translated: And the Ratnakaranda says,

original: 'jig rten rga bas gzir gyur cing //
analyzed: 'jig rten rga bas gzir gyur cing //
translated: The world is oppressed by old age

original: 'chi bdag gis ni yongs bskor ba //
analyzed: 'chi bdag gis ni yongs bskor ba //
translated: and completely surrounded by the Lord of Death.

original: de phyir gnyi ga spang ba'i phyir //🔽rab tu byung ba legs par gzung //
analyzed: de phyir gnyi ga spang ba'i phyir // rab tu byung ba legs par gzung //
translated: Therefore, in order to abandon both,

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: take up ordination.

original: dri ma med par grags pas zhus pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: dri ma med par grags pas zhus pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: And the Vimalakirti Sutra says,

original: thams cad nas kha na ma tho ba med pa 'di ni rab tu byung ba zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //🔽sbyangs pa'i yon tan gyi yo byad bsnyungs pa la dgongs pa bstan pa /
analyzed: thams cad nas kha na ma tho ba med pa 'di ni rab tu byung ba zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so // sbyangs pa'i yon tan gyi yo byad bsnyungs pa la dgongs pa bstan pa /
translated: This is called ordination, which is completely free of wrongdoing.🔽The Sutra Requested by Akshayamati also says,

original: chos yang dag par sdud pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: chos yang dag par sdud pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: The Sutra on Chanting the Dharma Together also says,

original: kha na ma tho ba med par bya ba'i phyir bsod snyoms spyod pa la 'jug go zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba med par bya ba'i phyir bsod snyoms spyod pa la 'jug go zhes gsungs so //
translated: He engages in the practice of begging for alms in order to be without sin.

original: bzhi pa brjod pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: bzhi pa brjod pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: The Four Statements Sutra also says,

original: lha'i bu bzhi po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod tshul yin no //
analyzed: lha'i bu bzhi po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod tshul yin no //
translated: “Divine son, these four are the conduct of bodhisattvas.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: gang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gang 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: khyim pa'i longs spyod dor nas rang gi longs spyod kyis chog shes pa dang / gzhan gyi nor mngon par mi 'dod pa nyid dang / rab tu byung nas 'phags pa'i rigs la dga' ba dang / sbyangs pa'i yon tan gyi yo byad bsnyungs ba nyid de /
analyzed: khyim pa'i longs spyod dor nas rang gi longs spyod kyis chog shes pa dang / gzhan gyi nor mngon par mi 'dod pa nyid dang / rab tu byung nas 'phags pa'i rigs la dga' ba dang / sbyangs pa'i yon tan gyi yo byad bsnyungs ba nyid de /
translated: Having given up the enjoyments of householders, they are content with their own enjoyments; they do not desire the wealth of others; having gone forth, they delight in the ārya lineage; and they are ascetic in their possessions and austerity.

original: bzhi po 'di dag go zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bzhi po 'di dag go zhes gsungs so //
translated: These are the four.”

original: sa'i snying po'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: sa'i snying po'i mdo las kyang /
translated: The Kṣitigarbha Sūtra also says,

original: gdul bar dka' ba'i sems sreg cing //
analyzed: gdul bar dka' ba'i sems sreg cing //
translated: “The mind is difficult to tame; it burns.

original: dge slong rnams pa rtsol mi byed //🔽'phags pa'i rigs la dga' gyur na //
analyzed: dge slong rnams pa rtsol mi byed // 'phags pa'i rigs la dga' gyur na //
translated: Monks, do not be lazy.🔽Having delighted in the ārya lineage,

original: rkang gnyis rnams kyi mchog tu 'gyur //
analyzed: rkang gnyis rnams kyi mchog tu 'gyur //
translated: you will become supreme among humans.”

original: sdig pa'i dge slong spong byed cing //
analyzed: sdig pa'i dge slong spong byed cing //
translated: “The monk who abandons evil

original: 'phags la gus pas sten par byed //
analyzed: 'phags la gus pas sten par byed //
translated: and respectfully serves the noble ones,

original: dge 'dun rdzas dag mi za na //
analyzed: dge 'dun rdzas dag mi za na //
translated: not eating the Saṅgha’s food,

original: myur du byang chub reg par 'gyur //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: myur du byang chub reg par 'gyur // zhes gsungs so //
translated: will quickly reach enlightenment.”

original: byang chub @92b sems dpa'i lam gyi mdo las kyang /
analyzed: byang chub @92b sems dpa'i lam gyi mdo las kyang /
translated: The Bodhisattvayāna Sūtra also says,

original: byang chub sems dpas bran ma yin pa dang / 'tsho ba gzhan la rag ma las pas 'tsho bar bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas bran ma yin pa dang / 'tsho ba gzhan la rag ma las pas 'tsho bar bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: “The bodhisattva should live without being a slave and without depending on others for a livelihood.”

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa nyan thos kyis las kyang /
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa nyan thos kyis las kyang /
translated: The Śrāvakayāna Yogācāra also says,

original: ji ltar na sbyangs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na sbyangs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa yin zhe na /
translated: “How is one endowed with the ascetic practices?

original: rnyed pas chog pa'i bsod snyoms pa dang / mthar gyis slong ba'i bsod snyoms pa dang / stan gcig pa dang / zas phyis mi len pa dang / chos gos gsum pa dang / phying pa pa dang / bya ga dar khrod pa dang / dgon pa pa dang /
analyzed: rnyed pas chog pa'i bsod snyoms pa dang / mthar gyis slong ba'i bsod snyoms pa dang / stan gcig pa dang / zas phyis mi len pa dang / chos gos gsum pa dang / phying pa pa dang / bya ga dar khrod pa dang / dgon pa pa dang /
translated: The one who is satisfied with whatever alms are obtained, the one who begs in sequence, the one who sits on one seat, the one who does not accept food later, the one who has three robes, the one who wears felt, the one who wears discarded rags, the one who lives in the forest,

original: shing drung pa dang / bla ga ba med pa dang / dur khrod pa dang / cog pu ba dang / gzhi ji bzhin pa ste /🔽de dag kyang bsod snyoms pa dang / chos gos dang / gnas mal las brtsams nas /
analyzed: shing drung pa dang / bla ga ba med pa dang / dur khrod pa dang / cog pu ba dang / gzhi ji bzhin pa ste / de dag kyang bsod snyoms pa dang / chos gos dang / gnas mal las brtsams nas /
translated: the tree-root-dweller, the charnel-ground-dweller, the open-air-dweller, the any-bed-user, and the just-as-received-user.

original: sbyangs pa'i yon tan bcu gnyis sam bcu gsum du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sbyangs pa'i yon tan bcu gnyis sam bcu gsum du 'gyur ro //
translated: These are the twelve or thirteen ascetic practices, beginning with the alms-food-eater, the refuse-rag-wearer, and the any-bed-user.

original: de la bsod snyoms pa nyid las dbye na rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la bsod snyoms pa nyid las dbye na rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The alms-food-eater is of two kinds:

original: rnyed pas chog pa'i bsod snyoms pa dang / mthar gyis slong ba'i bsod snyoms pa'o //
analyzed: rnyed pas chog pa'i bsod snyoms pa dang / mthar gyis slong ba'i bsod snyoms pa'o //
translated: the one satisfied with what he gets and the one who goes on a continuous round of solicitation.

original: de la rnyed pas chog pa'i bsod snyoms pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la rnyed pas chog pa'i bsod snyoms pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the alms-food-eater who is satisfied with what he gets?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is he

original: 'dris pa'i khyim dag nas ci thob pa dang / ci snyed pa tsam za bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'dris pa'i khyim dag nas ci thob pa dang / ci snyed pa tsam za bar byed pa'o //
translated: who eats whatever he gets, whatever quantity, from the first house he comes to.

original: mthar gyis slong ba'i bsod snyoms pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: mthar gyis slong ba'i bsod snyoms pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the alms-food-eater who goes on a continuous round of solicitation?

original: khyim rnams su khang khyim nas khang khyim du bslangs shing brgyus te /
analyzed: khyim rnams su khang khyim nas khang khyim du bslangs shing brgyus te /
translated: It is he who, having gone to the houses in order, eats whatever he gets, whatever quantity, from each house.

original: bsod snyoms ci thob pa dang / ci snyed pa za bar byed kyi /
analyzed: bsod snyoms ci thob pa dang / ci snyed pa za bar byed kyi /
translated: He eats whatever alms he receives, whatever he gets,

original: bdag gis 'di nas bza' ba dang / bca' ba bzang po ci tsam 'dod pa thob par 'gyur ro snyam nas mgo 'phang bstod de /
analyzed: bdag gis 'di nas bza' ba dang / bca' ba bzang po ci tsam 'dod pa thob par 'gyur ro snyam nas mgo 'phang bstod de /
translated: without thinking, “I hope to get good food here.”

original: khyim rnams su mi 'gro ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: khyim rnams su mi 'gro ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: He does not go to the houses of the wealthy with the idea of getting food.

original: de la bsod snyoms pa nyid bye brag tu ma phye ba las brtsams nas ni sbyangs pa'i yon tan bcu gnyis su 'gyur la /
analyzed: de la bsod snyoms pa nyid bye brag tu ma phye ba las brtsams nas ni sbyangs pa'i yon tan bcu gnyis su 'gyur la /
translated: If the practice of the alms-round is not specified, then there are twelve ascetic practices.

original: bye brag tu phye ba las brtsams na ni bcu gsum mo //
analyzed: bye brag tu phye ba las brtsams na ni bcu gsum mo //
translated: If it is specified, there are thirteen.

original: de la dgon pa nyid ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la dgon pa nyid ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: There are three kinds of forest-dweller:

original: chen po dang 'bring dang chung ngu'o //
analyzed: chen po dang 'bring dang chung ngu'o //
translated: great, middling, and small.

original: dgon pa pa chen po nyid gang zhe na /🔽rdul phra rab bdun la rdul lo //
analyzed: dgon pa pa chen po nyid gang zhe na / rdul phra rab bdun la rdul lo //
translated: What is the great forest-dweller?🔽Seven atoms make one paramanu.

original: rdul bdun la sro ma'o //🔽sro ma bdun la shig go //🔽shig bdun la nas so //
analyzed: rdul bdun la sro ma'o // sro ma bdun la shig go // shig bdun la nas so //
translated: Seven paramānus make one louse.🔽Seven lice make one barley-seed.

original: nas bdun la sor tshigs so //
analyzed: nas bdun la sor tshigs so //
translated: Seven barley-seeds make one finger-width.

original: sor tshigs bcu gnyis la mtho'o //🔽mtho gnyis la khru'o //
analyzed: sor tshigs bcu gnyis la mtho'o // mtho gnyis la khru'o //
translated: Twelve finger-widths make one cubit.

original: khru bzhi la gzhu 'dom mo //🔽gzhu 'dom lnga la srog shing ngo //
analyzed: khru bzhi la gzhu 'dom mo // gzhu 'dom lnga la srog shing ngo //
translated: Four cubits make one bow-length.🔽Five hundred bow-lengths make one earshot.

original: srog shing nyi shu la ngal so'o //
analyzed: srog shing nyi shu la ngal so'o //
translated: Twenty earshots make one half-league.

original: ngal so brgyad cu la rgyang grags so //
analyzed: ngal so brgyad cu la rgyang grags so //
translated: Eighty earshots make one league.

original: gzhu 'dom stong phrag brgyad po de na gnas pa ni dgon pa pa chen po'o //
analyzed: gzhu 'dom stong phrag brgyad po de na gnas pa ni dgon pa pa chen po'o //
translated: One who lives eight thousand bow-lengths from a village is a great forest-dweller.

original: dgon pa pa 'bring ni gang zhe na /
analyzed: dgon pa pa 'bring ni gang zhe na /
translated: What is a middling forest-dweller?

original: bshad pa / gzhu 'dom stong phrag ste khru ba zhe stong na gnas pa'o //
analyzed: bshad pa / gzhu 'dom stong phrag ste khru ba zhe stong na gnas pa'o //
translated: He says: It is a place that is one thousand bow-leagues away, or one hundred and twenty yojanas.

original: dgon pa ba chung ngu gang zhe na /
analyzed: dgon pa ba chung ngu gang zhe na /
translated: What is a small forest?

original: gzhu 'dom lnga brgyar bgrangs pa ste /
analyzed: gzhu 'dom lnga brgyar bgrangs pa ste /
translated: It is a place that is five hundred bow-leagues away,

original: khru stong phrag gnyis su 'gyur ba na gnas pa'o //
analyzed: khru stong phrag gnyis su 'gyur ba na gnas pa'o //
translated: or two thousand yojanas.

original: rgyu cis dgon pa pa yin na lam gyi chad kyis sam rnam pas yin zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu cis dgon pa pa yin na lam gyi chad kyis sam rnam pas yin zhe na /
translated: By what means is it a forest? Is it by the measure of the path or by its appearance?

original: bshad pa / lam gyi tshad kyis dgon pa par rab tu shes kyi /
analyzed: bshad pa / lam gyi tshad kyis dgon pa par rab tu shes kyi /
translated: He says: It is known as a forest by the measure of the path,

original: rnam pas ni ma yin no //🔽grong mtha' ba yin la dgon pa pa ma yin pa yang yod /
analyzed: rnam pas ni ma yin no // grong mtha' ba yin la dgon pa pa ma yin pa yang yod /
translated: but not by its appearance.🔽There is a forest that is not a village border,

original: dgon pa pa yin la grong mtha' pa ma yin pa yang yod /
analyzed: dgon pa pa yin la grong mtha' pa ma yin pa yang yod /
translated: there is a village border that is not a forest,

original: dgon pa pa yin la grong mtha' pa yin pa yang yod /
analyzed: dgon pa pa yin la grong mtha' pa yin pa yang yod /
translated: there is a forest that is also a village border,

original: dgon pa pa ma yin la grong mtha' pa ma yin pa yang yod do //
analyzed: dgon pa pa ma yin la grong mtha' pa ma yin pa yang yod do //
translated: and there is that which is neither a forest nor a village border.

original: de la grong mtha' pa ma yin la dgon pa pa ma yin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la grong mtha' pa ma yin la dgon pa pa ma yin pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is not a village border and not a forest?

original: dgon pa na yang gnas la grong la rtog pa rnam par rtog par byed cing /
analyzed: dgon pa na yang gnas la grong la rtog pa rnam par rtog par byed cing /
translated: It is a place where one dwells in a forest but thinks about and conceptualizes a village.

original: nges par 'byung ba la rtog par mi byed pa ste /
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba la rtog par mi byed pa ste /
translated: He does not consider renunciation.

original: 'di ni grong mtha' ba yin la dgon pa pa ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni grong mtha' ba yin la dgon pa pa ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is the one who is a villager but not a forest dweller.

original: dgon pa pa yin la grong mtha' pa ma yin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: dgon pa pa yin la grong mtha' pa ma yin pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the one who is a forest dweller but not a villager?

original: grong mtha' yang gnas la /
analyzed: grong mtha' yang gnas la /
translated: He lives in the forest

original: @96b sems kyis dben pa la gzhol /
analyzed: @96b sems kyis dben pa la gzhol /
translated: but his mind is not inclined toward solitude,

original: dben pa la 'bab /🔽dben pa la 'bab pa /
analyzed: dben pa la 'bab / dben pa la 'bab pa /
translated: does not rest in solitude,🔽does not rest in the goal of solitude,

original: bsrings pa / nges par 'byung ba la dga' ba ste /
analyzed: bsrings pa / nges par 'byung ba la dga' ba ste /
translated: does not delight in renunciation.

original: 'di ni dgon pa yin la grong mtha' ba ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dgon pa yin la grong mtha' ba ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is the one who is a forest dweller but not a villager.

original: dgon pa pa yang yin la grong mtha' yang yin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: dgon pa pa yang yin la grong mtha' yang yin pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the one who is both a forest dweller and a villager?

original: nyon mongs pa rnams dang ma 'dres pa ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams dang ma 'dres pa ste /
translated: He is not mixed with the defilements.

original: 'di ni dgon pa pa yang yin la grong mtha' ba yang yin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dgon pa pa yang yin la grong mtha' ba yang yin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is the one who is both a forest dweller and a villager.

original: dgon pa pa yang ma yin la grong mtha' ba yang ma yin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: dgon pa pa yang ma yin la grong mtha' ba yang ma yin pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the one who is neither a forest dweller nor a villager?

original: bzlog pa ste /
analyzed: bzlog pa ste /
translated: The opposite.

original: 'di ni dgon pa pa yang ma yin la grong mtha' ba yang ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dgon pa pa yang ma yin la grong mtha' ba yang ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is the one who is neither a forest dweller nor a villager.

original: dgon pa na gnas shing /🔽gzhan yang dge 'dun gyi bya ba dag dang / nad pa'i bya ba dag gi ched dam /
analyzed: dgon pa na gnas shing / gzhan yang dge 'dun gyi bya ba dag dang / nad pa'i bya ba dag gi ched dam /
translated: He lives in a monastery.🔽Moreover, he enters the village for the sake of the Saṅgha’s activities, for the sake of the activities of the sick,

original: chos nyan pa'i dbang du byas nas grong mthar 'jug par 'gyur ba na /
analyzed: chos nyan pa'i dbang du byas nas grong mthar 'jug par 'gyur ba na /
translated: or for the sake of listening to the Dharma.

original: 'di ltar gdon mi za bar dgon par 'gro bar bya'o snyam du sems skyed par byed cing /
analyzed: 'di ltar gdon mi za bar dgon par 'gro bar bya'o snyam du sems skyed par byed cing /
translated: He should generate the thought, “I will definitely go to the wilderness.”

original: der gnas pa la skya rengs shar ba na yang sbyangs pa'i yan lag 'khrug par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: der gnas pa la skya rengs shar ba na yang sbyangs pa'i yan lag 'khrug par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: When he stays there, even if the dawn breaks, he will not be disturbed in his ascetic practices.

original: ci ste yang dgon par 'gro bar mi bya'o snyam du sems skyed par byed na /
analyzed: ci ste yang dgon par 'gro bar mi bya'o snyam du sems skyed par byed na /
translated: But if he generates the thought, “I will not go to the wilderness,”

original: skya rengs shar ba dang lhan cig sbyangs pa'i yan lag 'khrug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skya rengs shar ba dang lhan cig sbyangs pa'i yan lag 'khrug par 'gyur ro //
translated: then he will be disturbed in his ascetic practices as soon as the dawn breaks.

original: ci zhig bkag pa las sbyangs pa'i yan lag bsod snyoms pa nyid yang dag par len pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhig bkag pa las sbyangs pa'i yan lag bsod snyoms pa nyid yang dag par len pa yin zhe na /
translated: What is the ascetic practice of begging that he takes up by refraining from what?

original: bshad pa dge 'dun gyi rnyed pa dgag pa'i phyir sbyangs pa'i yon tan bsod snyoms pa nyid yang dag par len pa yin no de la bsod snyoms pa nyid ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: bshad pa dge 'dun gyi rnyed pa dgag pa'i phyir sbyangs pa'i yon tan bsod snyoms pa nyid yang dag par len pa yin no de la bsod snyoms pa nyid ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Asceticism is threefold:

original: chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po'o //
analyzed: chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po'o //
translated: inferior, middling, and superior.

original: bsod snyoms ba chung ngu gang zhe na /🔽zas lnga po rnams las /
analyzed: bsod snyoms ba chung ngu gang zhe na / zas lnga po rnams las /
translated: What is inferior asceticism?🔽It is not to accept any of the five kinds of offerings

original: gang yang rung ba mgron du gnyer ba'i zas mi len pa ste /
analyzed: gang yang rung ba mgron du gnyer ba'i zas mi len pa ste /
translated: from those who invite one to do so.

original: 'di ni bsod snyoms pa chung ngu'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bsod snyoms pa chung ngu'o //
translated: This is inferior asceticism.

original: bsod snyoms pa 'di nyid gang zhe na /🔽zas lnga po dag las mgron du gnyer ba mi len cing /🔽slong mos mgron du gnyer ba yang mi len la /
analyzed: bsod snyoms pa 'di nyid gang zhe na / zas lnga po dag las mgron du gnyer ba mi len cing / slong mos mgron du gnyer ba yang mi len la /
translated: What is middling asceticism?🔽It is not to accept any of the five kinds of offerings from those who invite one to do so,🔽nor to accept invitations to meals offered by those who invite one to do so,

original: sa phyogs ga ge mo zhes bya ba dang grong ga ge mo zhes bya bar shog shig ces brda byed pa ste /
analyzed: sa phyogs ga ge mo zhes bya ba dang grong ga ge mo zhes bya bar shog shig ces brda byed pa ste /
translated: but to accept food brought in response to a request made by a sign.

original: 'di ni bsod snyoms pa 'bring nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni bsod snyoms pa 'bring nyid do //
translated: This is middling asceticism.

original: bsod snyoms pa chen po gang zhe na /
analyzed: bsod snyoms pa chen po gang zhe na /
translated: What is superior asceticism?

original: zas lnga po dag las gang yang rung ba la mgron du gnyer ba'i zas mi len /
analyzed: zas lnga po dag las gang yang rung ba la mgron du gnyer ba'i zas mi len /
translated: He does not accept any of the five kinds of invitations to meals.

original: slong mos mgron du gnyer ba yang mi len /
analyzed: slong mos mgron du gnyer ba yang mi len /
translated: He does not accept invitations to meals from lay people.

original: brda byas par yang mi 'gro zhig /
analyzed: brda byas par yang mi 'gro zhig /
translated: He does not go to a place where he is told, “Come and get it.”

original: khyim gyi sgor gnas pa nyid kyis bsod snyoms len pa ste /
analyzed: khyim gyi sgor gnas pa nyid kyis bsod snyoms len pa ste /
translated: He accepts alms only while standing at the door of the house.

original: 'di ni bsod snyoms pa chen po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bsod snyoms pa chen po'o //
translated: This is the great alms-food rule.

original: ci zhig bkag @97a * //
analyzed: ci zhig bkag @97a * //
translated: What is the purpose of this rule?

original: pa las sbyangs pa'i yan lag phyag dar khrod pa nyid yang dag par len pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: pa las sbyangs pa'i yan lag phyag dar khrod pa nyid yang dag par len pa yin zhe na /
translated: The purpose of this rule is to avoid the fault of accepting invitations to meals.

original: khyim bdag gi gos dgag pa'i phyir sbyangs pa'i yan lag phyag dar khrod pa nyid yang dag par len pa yin no //
analyzed: khyim bdag gi gos dgag pa'i phyir sbyangs pa'i yan lag phyag dar khrod pa nyid yang dag par len pa yin no //
translated: The purpose of the rule of wearing rag-robes is to avoid the fault of wearing the robes of householders.

original: de la phyag dar khrod pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la phyag dar khrod pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: There are three kinds of rag-robes:

original: chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po'o //
analyzed: chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po'o //
translated: small, medium, and large.

original: phyag dar khrod pa chung ngu gang zhe na /
analyzed: phyag dar khrod pa chung ngu gang zhe na /
translated: What are small rag-robes?

original: byi bas zos pa dang grog mas zos pa dang rnam par tshig pa dang / dum bur bcad nas hral te ched du byas nas por ba de len pa ste 'di ni phyag dar khrod pa chung ngu'o //
analyzed: byi bas zos pa dang grog mas zos pa dang rnam par tshig pa dang / dum bur bcad nas hral te ched du byas nas por ba de len pa ste 'di ni phyag dar khrod pa chung ngu'o //
translated: The small refuse-rag wearer is one who takes only what has been discarded by others, not what has been set aside for him.

original: phyag dar khrod pa 'bring nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: phyag dar khrod pa 'bring nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the medium refuse-rag wearer?

original: ched du byas nas por ba mi len cing /
analyzed: ched du byas nas por ba mi len cing /
translated: He does not take what has been set aside for him,

original: gang sngar byas pa ma nges par bor ba de len pa ste /
analyzed: gang sngar byas pa ma nges par bor ba de len pa ste /
translated: but takes only what has been discarded by others without any certainty as to time.

original: 'di ni phyag dar khrod pa 'bring nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni phyag dar khrod pa 'bring nyid do //
translated: This is the medium refuse-rag wearer.

original: phyag dar khrod pa chen po gang zhe na /
analyzed: phyag dar khrod pa chen po gang zhe na /
translated: What is the great refuse-rag wearer?

original: byi bas zos pa la hral te ched du byas nas bor ba'i bar du len cing /
analyzed: byi bas zos pa la hral te ched du byas nas bor ba'i bar du len cing /
translated: He takes what has been discarded by others, even if it is torn by rats or ants, or burned, or cut to pieces.

original: dur khrod dang phyag dar khrod dang lam du lhung ba rnyed nas len pa ste /
analyzed: dur khrod dang phyag dar khrod dang lam du lhung ba rnyed nas len pa ste /
translated: He takes what he finds in the charnel ground, in the refuse heap, or on the road.

original: 'di ni phyag dar khrod pa chen po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni phyag dar khrod pa chen po'o //
translated: This is the great refuse-rag wearer.

original: ci zhig bkag pa las sbyangs pa'i yan lag zas phyis mi len pa nyid yang dag par len pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhig bkag pa las sbyangs pa'i yan lag zas phyis mi len pa nyid yang dag par len pa yin zhe na /
translated: What is the ascetic practice of not taking food after begging rounds?

original: bshad pa / zas lhag pa dgag pa'i phyir sbyangs pa'i yan lag zas phyis mi len pa nyid yang dag par len pa yin no //
analyzed: bshad pa / zas lhag pa dgag pa'i phyir sbyangs pa'i yan lag zas phyis mi len pa nyid yang dag par len pa yin no //
translated: The Master says: In order to stop overeating, one should take up the ascetic practices of not taking food after begging rounds.

original: de la zas phyis mi len pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la zas phyis mi len pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: There are three kinds of not taking food after begging rounds:

original: chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po'o //
analyzed: chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po'o //
translated: small, medium, and great.

original: zas phyis mi len pa chung ngu gang zhe na /
analyzed: zas phyis mi len pa chung ngu gang zhe na /
translated: What is the small kind of not taking food after begging rounds?

original: stan ma ber ba bzhin du zos nas kyang ma bkrus par za ba ste /
analyzed: stan ma ber ba bzhin du zos nas kyang ma bkrus par za ba ste /
translated: One eats like a bird, without washing the bowl.

original: 'di ni zas phyis mi len pa chung ngu'o //
analyzed: 'di ni zas phyis mi len pa chung ngu'o //
translated: This is the small kind of not taking food after begging rounds.

original: zas phyis mi len pa 'bring nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: zas phyis mi len pa 'bring nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the medium kind of not taking food after begging rounds?

original: gang zhig za bzhin du bstabs pa lhag ma med par za ba de ni zas phyis mi len pa 'bring po nyid do //
analyzed: gang zhig za bzhin du bstabs pa lhag ma med par za ba de ni zas phyis mi len pa 'bring po nyid do //
translated: One eats what is served without leaving any leftovers. This is the medium kind of not taking food after begging rounds.

original: zas phyis mi len pa chen po gang zhe na /🔽za bzhin du mi len cing /
analyzed: zas phyis mi len pa chen po gang zhe na / za bzhin du mi len cing /
translated: What is the great kind of not taking food after begging rounds?🔽One does not take food while eating,

original: zos nas kyang mi len pa ste /
analyzed: zos nas kyang mi len pa ste /
translated: and does not take food after finishing.

original: 'di ni zas phyis mi len pa chen po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni zas phyis mi len pa chen po'o //
translated: This is the great kind of not taking food after begging rounds.

original: ci zhig bkag pa las sbyangs pa'i yan lag stan gcig pa nyid yang dag par len pa yin zhe na /🔽bshad pa / stan tha dad la za ba dgag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ci zhig bkag pa las sbyangs pa'i yan lag stan gcig pa nyid yang dag par len pa yin zhe na / bshad pa / stan tha dad la za ba dgag pa'i phyir /
translated: What is the branch of training that is correctly taken up by one who has stopped eating in this way?

original: sbyangs pa'i yan lag stan gcig pa nyid yang dag par len pa yin no //
analyzed: sbyangs pa'i yan lag stan gcig pa nyid yang dag par len pa yin no //
translated: It is the branch of training that is correctly taken up by one who has stopped eating on different seats.

original: de la stan gcig pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la stan gcig pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: There are three kinds of eating on one seat:

original: chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po'o //
analyzed: chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po'o //
translated: small, medium, and great.

original: stan gcig pa chung ngu gang zhe na /
analyzed: stan gcig pa chung ngu gang zhe na /
translated: What is the small kind of eating on one seat?

original: stan ma spangs par dus ji srid kyi bar du za ba ste /
analyzed: stan ma spangs par dus ji srid kyi bar du za ba ste /
translated: It is eating as long as one does not get up from one’s seat.

original: 'di ni stan gcig pa chung ngu'o /
analyzed: 'di ni stan gcig pa chung ngu'o /
translated: This is the small kind of eating on one seat.

original: @97b stan gcig pa 'bring nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: @97b stan gcig pa 'bring nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the medium kind of eating on one seat?

original: zos nas kyang zas bsod pa rnyed pa len pa ste /
analyzed: zos nas kyang zas bsod pa rnyed pa len pa ste /
translated: It is eating after having received food that is better than what one had before.

original: 'di ni stan gcig pa 'bring nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni stan gcig pa 'bring nyid do //
translated: This is the medium kind of eating on one seat.

original: stan gcig pa chen po gang zhe na /
analyzed: stan gcig pa chen po gang zhe na /
translated: What is the great kind of eating on one seat?

original: gang zhig za bzhin pa dang zos nas zas rnyed kyang mi za bar sngar bslangs ba zos nas 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: gang zhig za bzhin pa dang zos nas zas rnyed kyang mi za bar sngar bslangs ba zos nas 'gro ba ste /
translated: It is eating what one has received before, without eating what one has received later, even though one is still hungry, and then leaving.

original: 'di ni stan gcig pa chen po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni stan gcig pa chen po'o //
translated: This is the great kind of eating on one seat.

original: ci zhig bkag pa las sbyangs pa'i yan lag lhung bzed kyi bsod snyoms pa nyid yang dag par len pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhig bkag pa las sbyangs pa'i yan lag lhung bzed kyi bsod snyoms pa nyid yang dag par len pa yin zhe na /
translated: What is the branch of training that is undertaken by one who rejects the use of a begging bowl?

original: bshad pa / snod gzhan dgag pa'i phyir sbyangs pa'i yan lag lhung bzed kyi bsod snyoms pa nyid yang dag par len pa yin no //
analyzed: bshad pa / snod gzhan dgag pa'i phyir sbyangs pa'i yan lag lhung bzed kyi bsod snyoms pa nyid yang dag par len pa yin no //
translated: It is said: The branch of training that is undertaken by one who rejects the use of a begging bowl is undertaken in order to reject the use of other vessels.

original: de la lhung bzed kyi bsod snyoms pa nyid ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la lhung bzed kyi bsod snyoms pa nyid ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: There are three types of the branch of training that is undertaken by one who rejects the use of a begging bowl:

original: chung dang 'bring dang chen po'o //
analyzed: chung dang 'bring dang chen po'o //
translated: small, medium, and great.

original: lhung bzed kyi bsod snyoms pa chung ngu gang zhe na /
analyzed: lhung bzed kyi bsod snyoms pa chung ngu gang zhe na /
translated: What is the small type of the branch of training that is undertaken by one who rejects the use of a begging bowl?

original: gang zhig lag pa gnyis kyis bcad nas bza' bar nus pa ste /
analyzed: gang zhig lag pa gnyis kyis bcad nas bza' bar nus pa ste /
translated: It is the ability to eat with both hands after cutting up the food.

original: 'di ni lhung bzed kyi bsod snyoms pa chung ngu'o //
analyzed: 'di ni lhung bzed kyi bsod snyoms pa chung ngu'o //
translated: This is the small type of the branch of training that is undertaken by one who rejects the use of a begging bowl.

original: lhung bzed kyi bsod snyoms pa 'bring nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: lhung bzed kyi bsod snyoms pa 'bring nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the medium type of the branch of training that is undertaken by one who rejects the use of a begging bowl?

original: gang zhig lag pa gcig gis bcad nas za bar nus pa ste /
analyzed: gang zhig lag pa gcig gis bcad nas za bar nus pa ste /
translated: It is the ability to eat with one hand after cutting up the food.

original: 'di ni lhung bzed kyi bsod snyoms pa 'bring du 'dod do //
analyzed: 'di ni lhung bzed kyi bsod snyoms pa 'bring du 'dod do //
translated: This is considered the medium type of the branch of training that is undertaken by one who rejects the use of a begging bowl.

analyzed: des smras pa /

translated: This is the great form of the three robes.

original: dgon pa pa dang bsod snyoms te //

original: thub pa zhi pa'i thugs mnga' bas //

original: sbyangs pa bcu gnyis 'di dag gsungs //

original: de la phyag dar khrod pa nyid ni yang dag par blangs pa sngon du 'gro bas /
analyzed: de la phyag dar khrod pa nyid ni yang dag par blangs pa sngon du 'gro bas /
translated: The first, the practice of the refuse rag garments, is to take up the practice of wearing only garments made from rags discarded in a refuse heap.🔽

original: ras ma bor ba 'chang ba'o //🔽cog pu pa nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: ras ma bor ba 'chang ba'o // cog pu pa nyid gang zhe na /
translated: The ascetic practice of the refuse rag wearer is to wear robes made from discarded rags, having first undertaken the vow.

original: yang dag par blangs pa sngon du 'gro bas /
analyzed: yang dag par blangs pa sngon du 'gro bas /
translated: The ascetic practice of the triple-robe wearer is to go naked, having first undertaken the vow.

original: glos mi 'bebs par cog pus mtshan mo 'da' bar byed pa'o //🔽zas phyis mi len pa nyid ni /🔽yang dag par blangs pa sngon du 'gro bas /🔽zos pa bstabs kyang mi za zhing /
analyzed: glos mi 'bebs par cog pus mtshan mo 'da' bar byed pa'o // zas phyis mi len pa nyid ni / yang dag par blangs pa sngon du 'gro bas / zos pa bstabs kyang mi za zhing /
translated: The ascetic practice of the sitter is to spend the night in a cross-legged posture, having first undertaken the vow.🔽The ascetic practice of not eating food after the proper time is to not eat food after the proper time, having first undertaken the vow.

original: dus ma yin pa'i btung ba mi 'thung ba'o //
analyzed: dus ma yin pa'i btung ba mi 'thung ba'o //
translated: The ascetic practice of the open-air dweller is to not stay in a roofed shelter, having first undertaken the vow.

original: phying pa ba nyid ni yang dag par blangs pa sngon du 'gro bas phying pa'i gos 'chang ba'o //🔽chos gos gsum pa nyid ni /🔽yang dag par blangs pa sngon du 'gro bas /🔽chos gos gsum tsam 'chang gi lhag pa mi 'chang ba'o //
analyzed: phying pa ba nyid ni yang dag par blangs pa sngon du 'gro bas phying pa'i gos 'chang ba'o // chos gos gsum pa nyid ni / yang dag par blangs pa sngon du 'gro bas / chos gos gsum tsam 'chang gi lhag pa mi 'chang ba'o //
translated: The ascetic practice of the charnel-ground dweller is to stay in the charnel ground, having first undertaken the vow.🔽The ascetic practice of the whatever-bed user is to sleep wherever one happens to be, having first undertaken the vow.

original: shing drung pa nyid ni //
analyzed: shing drung pa nyid ni //
translated: The ascetic practice of the tree-root-dweller is to stay at the foot of a tree, having first undertaken the vow.

original: shing drung la dga' bas yang dag par blangs pa sngon du 'gro bas shing drung du gnas kyi /
analyzed: shing drung la dga' bas yang dag par blangs pa sngon du 'gro bas shing drung du gnas kyi /
translated: Since he delights in the foot of a tree, he takes up the vow and then lives at the foot of a tree.

original: bskyor bar mi 'jug pa'o //🔽stan gcig pa nyid ni /🔽yang dag par blangs pa sngon du 'gro bas /
analyzed: bskyor bar mi 'jug pa'o // stan gcig pa nyid ni / yang dag par blangs pa sngon du 'gro bas /
translated: He does not enter a shelter.

original: stan gnyis pa la mi za ba'o //🔽gzhi ji bzhin pa nyid ni /🔽yang dag par blangs pa sngon du 'gro bas /
analyzed: stan gnyis pa la mi za ba'o // gzhi ji bzhin pa nyid ni / yang dag par blangs pa sngon du 'gro bas /
translated: He takes up the vow and then does not eat on a second seat.🔽He takes up the vow and then enjoys whatever resting places, etc. ,

original: ji ltar thob pa'i gnas mal la sogs pa longs spyod pa'o //🔽dur khrod pa nyid ni /🔽yang dag par blangs pa sngon du 'gro bas /
analyzed: ji ltar thob pa'i gnas mal la sogs pa longs spyod pa'o // dur khrod pa nyid ni / yang dag par blangs pa sngon du 'gro bas /
translated: he has obtained.

original: dur khrod nyid du gnas pa'o //🔽bla gab med pa nyid ni /🔽yang dag par blangs pa sngon du 'gro bas /🔽g-yogs pa 'am shing drung du mi 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: dur khrod nyid du gnas pa'o // bla gab med pa nyid ni / yang dag par blangs pa sngon du 'gro bas / g-yogs pa 'am shing drung du mi 'jug pa'o //
translated: He takes up the vow and then lives in a charnel ground.

original: dgon pa pa nyid ni /🔽yang dag par blangs pa sngon du 'gro bas /🔽mi mi rgyu ba'i yul du ri dags dang bya bzhin gnas pa ste /
analyzed: dgon pa pa nyid ni / yang dag par blangs pa sngon du 'gro bas / mi mi rgyu ba'i yul du ri dags dang bya bzhin gnas pa ste /
translated: He takes up the vow and then does not enter a shelter or the foot of a tree.

original: gang yang rung bar nyal ba'o //
analyzed: gang yang rung bar nyal ba'o //
translated: He takes up the vow and then lives in a place where people do not go, like a deer or a bird, sleeping anywhere suitable.

original: bsod snyoms pa nyid ni /🔽yang dag par blangs pa sngon du 'gro bas /
analyzed: bsod snyoms pa nyid ni / yang dag par blangs pa sngon du 'gro bas /
translated: The quality of living on alms food is as follows.

original: bsod snyoms mang ba'am nyung ba len pa dang / mnyam pa'i sems nyid kyis dge 'dun gyi zas la mi ltos pa'o //
analyzed: bsod snyoms mang ba'am nyung ba len pa dang / mnyam pa'i sems nyid kyis dge 'dun gyi zas la mi ltos pa'o //
translated: Having taken up this practice, one accepts a large or small amount of alms food, but one does not depend on the food of the community because one has an attitude of equanimity.

original: phyag dar khrod pa nyid la yon tan bcu ste /
analyzed: phyag dar khrod pa nyid la yon tan bcu ste /
translated: The quality of wearing robes made of rags has ten aspects.

original: chos gos kyi don du khyim pa rnams dang mi 'dris pa dang / mi slong ba dang / gos kyi rgyus yongs su mi gtam pa dang / kun nas yongs su mi tshol ba dang / ma rnyed pas mi khro ba dang / rnyed pas dga' ba med pa dang /
analyzed: chos gos kyi don du khyim pa rnams dang mi 'dris pa dang / mi slong ba dang / gos kyi rgyus yongs su mi gtam pa dang / kun nas yongs su mi tshol ba dang / ma rnyed pas mi khro ba dang / rnyed pas dga' ba med pa dang /
translated: One does not associate with householders for the sake of robes, one does not beg for them, one does not talk about robes, one does not search for them, one is not angry if one does not obtain them, and one does not feel elated if one does obtain them.🔽One accepts what is available, which is little and easy to obtain, and is free of any moral fault.

original: nyung ba dang rnyed sla ba dang / kha na ma thob med pa khas len pa dang / gnas na rjes su mthun par 'jug par 'gyur pa dang / chos gos @100a * //
analyzed: nyung ba dang rnyed sla ba dang / kha na ma thob med pa khas len pa dang / gnas na rjes su mthun par 'jug par 'gyur pa dang / chos gos @100a * //
translated: One is in harmony with the teachings, and one wears rough robes.

original: rtsub par bgo ba dang / gzhan gyis glags mi tshol ba'o //
analyzed: rtsub par bgo ba dang / gzhan gyis glags mi tshol ba'o //
translated: One does not seek to take advantage of others.

original: stan gcig pa nyid la yon tan bcu ste /
analyzed: stan gcig pa nyid la yon tan bcu ste /
translated: The quality of having only one session of sitting in meditation a day has ten aspects.
